item.title: Tokenization Grand Prix Application - Hashnote $USYC
item.dc:creator: peterskalon
item.description:
I. Product Summary

1. Project name: US Yield Coin (USYC)

2. Product name: Hashnote International Short Duration Yield Fund Ltd. (iSDYF)

3. Product type / underlying asset: USYC is the on-chain representation of the regulated Hashnote International Short Duration Yield Fund Ltd. (“iSDYF”). The fund invests into reverse repo which is considered the safest way to keep cash in traditional finance, more safe than direct purchase of treasury bills. Net current yield is 4.737% and will float based on the secured overnight financing rate (SOFR).

4. Issuer jurisdiction: Cayman Islands

5. Product website: https://usyc.hashnote.com/

6. Primary contact name, title, and method of contact:

Name: Kat Daminova
Title: Director of Business Development
Email: kat@hashnote.com

II. Company Details

1. Company description: Hashnote is a regulated on-chain asset manager. We offer cash and treasury management, hedging and yield enhancement strategies and also long exposure to the crypto asset class.

We leverage most innovative technology and deep understanding of traditional finance to develop new products across our offerings: the US Yield Coin (USYC), a tokenized money market fund designed to serve as yield-bearing collateral for trading, lending, and borrowing; Hashnote Harbor, a solution that allows clients to earn yield without moving funds out of custody; and the CD20, a professionally managed index product that provides long exposure.

2. Key personnel biographies:

Leo Mizuhara | CEO & Founder

Leo spent 12 years at Bank of America, eventually departing as Managing Director managing the bank’s assets and liabilities as part of Corporate Investments. From there he spent five years running Fixed Income Currencies and Commodities Systematic Options Trading at DRW before launching Hashnote with DRW’s support.

Dave Shapiro | Chief Technology Officer

David has been an entrepreneur for the past 14 years. Before Hashnote, David Co-founded and led product and engineering as CTO of Scout Security (IPO ASX), a security-focused IoT firm. Later he served as VP of Engineering at Latch Inc (IPO NASDAQ).

Andrew Ridenour | Chief Regulatory Officer and General Counsel

Experienced regulator and in-house counsel, with an emphasis on derivatives and blockchain incubation as Special Counsel to the CFTC Chair, General Counsel at Cumberland Labs, and Institutional Counsel at Coinbase.

Kat Daminova | Director of Business Development EMEA

Kat leads business development at Hashnote for the EMEA region, with over a decade of experience in traditional finance, fintech, and digital assets. Before Hashnote, she held key roles at Gemini and was Head of Product at Copper. She has launched investment products across asset classes and developed software solutions, with notable positions at Goldman Sachs, UBS, and Leonteq.

3. Team size: ~12 people

4. Years in operation: ~2

III. Product Information

1. Describe the product: USYC earns short-term risk-free rate returns. Our clients, upon successfully completing KYC/AML, can instantly mint and redeem USYC into their whitelisted wallets 24/7 from USDC and PYUSD. USYC can also be minted and redeemed into USDT and fiat. The token is available as Ethereum ERC20, NEAR, BASE and will soon be integrated with Axelar.

2. Describe the underlying asset: USYC is the on-chain representation of Hashnote’s regulated International Short Duration Yield Fund (iSDYF). iSDYF uses its prime broker Marex and custodian BNY Mellon to invest cash into overnight reverse-repo to ensure minimised market risk, duration risk, and credit risk. Whether the investor chooses to purchase with fiat or stablecoin, the amount of USYC the investor receives is equal to the deposit amount divided by the current price of USYC. Hashnote mints into the investor’s wallet an amount of USYC tokens equivalent to the number of shares the investor has in the iSDYF.

3. How is yield transferred to the tokenholder (i.e., via rebasing, distributions, price accrual, etc.) and how often? We update the price of the token daily to reflect the yield that has been earned overnight.

4. What is the jurisdiction of the issuer and key entities? Hashnote International Short Duration Yield Fund Ltd (iSDYF), a mutual fund providing the USYC product, is domiciled in the Cayman Islands.

It is managed by its investment manager, Hasnote Management LLC, a United States limited liability company formed in Delaware.

We adhere to strict regulations, ensuring our operations meet institutional investment standards.

5. What is the asset eligibility criteria and/or concentration limitations for the portfolio as defined by the underlying documents? Our PPM permits investment into T Bills but currently we only invest into reverse repo.

6. Are any hedging or derivatives permitted in the underlying portfolio? No we don’t do any hedging; however, reverse repo can be described as a derivative product.

7. Provide a list of all counterparties and service providers used by your product (i.e., custodians, trustees, reporting agents, exchange agents, banks, etc). Provide flow-charts or diagrams for all related entities and counterparties, if available.

  • Custodian: Bank of NY Mellon
  • Liquidity Provider: Cumberland DRW LLC
  • Prime Broker: Marex Capital Markets Inc.
  • Fund Administrator; KYC Services: NAV Fund Services (Cayman) Ltd.
  • AML Service Provider: LMO Consulting Pte. Ltd.
  • Wallet Screening Services: Godwin Austen Advisory Pte. Ltd.
  • Auditor: Cohen & Co International
  • Bank: Customers Bank
  • MPC wallet: Fireblocks

8. What is the AUM of the product? Provide a breakdown by blockchain. AUM of the product is over $260mm, live data here: USYC | Hashnote

Chain Breakdown:

  • Ethereum $250+mm
  • Canto $3.5mm
  • NEAR $2.5mm
  • BASE …coming…

9. What are the standard fees (i.e., subscription, redemption, management, etc.)?

  • Subscription Fee: None for fiat, PYUSD and USDC // 0.10% for USDT
  • Redemption Fee: None for fiat, PYUSD and USDT // 0.10% for USDC
  • Performance Fee: 10% of Yield.

10. Other than the fees described above, can other expenses be paid from the proceeds of the product/assets? Hashnote charges performance fees via an inflationary minting of USYC tokens.

11. How is your product permissioned? (e.g., primary users, secondary users) USYC is a permissioned token that requires investors to undergo KYC/AML verification with Hashnote for both primary and secondary trading. Once an investor is onboarded, their wallet address is whitelisted, granting them permission to hold and transfer USYC. The smart contract will simply not allow mints or transfers of USYC into non-whitelisted wallet addresses.

12. What is the monthly transaction volume for the product? ~$300 million in the last month

13. What is the expected and maximum time for users to subscribe to and redeem from your product? Have you had any interruptions in your ability to process redemptions and subscriptions? Users can expect instant atomic on-chain 24/7 minting and redemptions into USDC and PUYSD 24/7 via Hashnote’s “Teller” smart contract.

Alternatively, onboarded users can use a “manual” method with fiat, USDC, USDT or PUYSD, T+0 or T+1. Redemptions made before 2:00 pm ET are processed by 5:00 pm ET the same day. Redemptions made after 2:00 pm ET are processed by 11:00 am ET the next day.

Hashnote has never had any service interruption for redemptions or subscriptions.

14. Provide a description of the subscription and redemption process. Include a diagram of the flow of funds, including each party involved. USYC can be obtained by onboarded investors through the Web3 smart contract method or the traditional method.

Web3 Smart Contract Method

Minting is available 24/7. Burning is available whenever contract amounts permit. Hashnote refills PYUSD teller at least once per business day to maintain instant redemption availability.

Subscription

  1. Go to the USYC Portal (usyc.hashnote.com)
  2. Connect your wallet to the Smart Contract Teller
  3. On the “Fund” tab, select the appropriate stablecoin (PYUSD or USDC) you wish to use for minting USYC and enter a deposit amount
  4. Enter the amount of USYC you wish to mint
  5. Click “Add Funds” to instantly deposit stablecoin and mint USYC into your designated whitelisted wallet at the price shown

Redemption

  1. Go to the USYC Portal (usyc.hashnote.com)
  2. Connect your wallet to the Smart Contract Teller
  3. On the “Redeem” tab, select the stablecoin you wish to receive (PYUSD or USDC)
  4. Enter the amount of USYC you wish to redeem
  5. Click “Redeem Funds” to burn USYC at the price shown and receive the selected stablecoin in your wallet

Traditional Method

Subscription and Redemption are available on US Business Days. Redemptions made before 2:00 pm ET are processed by 5:00 pm ET the same day. Redemptions made after 2:00 pm ET are processed by 11:00 am ET the next day.

Subscription

  1. Send stablecoin (PYUSD, USDC, or USDT) to Hashnote Short Duration Yield Fund (SDYF) wallet
  2. Notify a Hashnote representative
  3. Receive minted USYC in your designated whitelisted wallet

Redemption

  1. Send USYC to Hashnote SDYF wallet or burn USYC directly on-chain
  2. Notify a Hashnote representative
  3. Receive stablecoin or fiat

*Subscription

*Redemption

15. Have any liquidity vehicles been established to enhance redemption and subscription efficiency? If so, describe how they work. To help investors enter and exit their positions efficiently, we provide a Smart Contract Teller to facilitate investing in the fund and liquidating the asset on-chain. The Smart Contract Teller allows the client to have up to 100% instant liquidity into PYUSD at all times. Our market maker Cumberland can support additional liquidity and facilitate redemptions 24/7.

16. With what product can subscriptions and redemptions be made? (i.e., fiat, Dai, USDC, etc.) Onboarded clients can see the deposit address in their Hashnote portal. Hashnote will accept PUYSD, USDT, USDC or fiat as subscription and redemption assets. Upon acceptance as MakerDAO collateral, Hashnote will make DAI a redemption asset.

17. What are your future development plans for the product? We aim to enable instant, 24/7 minting and redemption of USYC into more stablecoins. USYC stands out from the rest of the tokenized RWAs as it finds its application across the digital asset ecosystem as a whole. As a treasury management tool and an alternative to holding stablecoins we are already backing the Usual stablecoin. As a collateral token used by custodians, centralised and decentralised exchanges, USYC boosts liquidity and collateral efficiency for trading, borrowing, and lending. To expand its reach, we are forming new partnerships, bridging to more chains, and adding market makers. By 2025, we plan to be available on multiple venues and currently adding more market makers.

IV. Legal Structure

1. Explain the legal structure of the product and the jurisdictions in which it operates Hashnote International Short Duration Yield Fund Ltd (iSDYF), a mutual fund providing the USYC product, is domiciled in the Cayman Islands. It is managed by its investment manager, Hasnote Management LLC, a United States limited liability company formed in Delaware.

What regulatory bodies oversee the product? Regulated by the U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) and Cayman Island Monetary Authority (CIMA)

2. What licences, permits, certificates, authorizations, registrations, concessions, approvals, exemptions does your product or company hold? Short Duration Yield Fund Ltd (iSDYF), a mutual fund providing the USYC product is regulated by the Cayman Islands Monetary Authority (CIMA). Hashnote Management LLC is registered as a Commodity Pool Operator (CPO) and Commodity Trading Advisor (CTA) with the National Futures Association (NFA), and it is regulated by the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC).

3. How is bankruptcy remoteness established for assets of this product? Does the issuer have more than one product? Please provide separately any related legal opinions or supplementary documents regarding bankruptcy remoteness All investments in the iSDYF fund are held in a bankruptcy-remote structure at our custodian, BNY Mellon, through our prime broker, Marex. iSDYF is a Cayman Islands mutual fund, and any resolution of the iSDYF fund would be independent of any potential resolution or bankruptcy involving Hashnote. Nearly all assets of the iSDYF fund are maintained in its prime brokerage account at Marex Capital Markets, a registered broker-dealer.

4. What rights do token holders have? Investors holding USYC are shareholders in the iSDYF fund and have redemption rights to their underlying shares in iSDYF under Cayman Islands law. When investors subscribe to iSDYF, they receive participating shares at the current price for that day. Shareholders, including the DAO, have rights to the fund’s assets under Cayman Islands bankruptcy law.

5. Are there any pending or threatened legal proceedings or investigations against the company or any of its officers? Hashnote and its officers have never been subjected to a criminal or legal enforcement action.

6. Describe any conflicts of interest the company or product may have with its officers or MakerDAO We have no conflicts of interest with MakerDAO or its officers.

7. Explain the potential tax implications associated with the product Although we cannot offer any tax advice, generally, if there is no US-connected income for the user, iSDYF does not create any US tax income obligations.

V. Performance, Reporting, and Technical

1. Provide historical performance relative to the most relevant benchmark and explanations for any deviations from the benchmark The token is interest accruing. This means the price of the token increases each business day. USYC is not a rebasing token.

2. Describe the frequency, content, and process for performance and portfolio transparency reports. Who provides these? Live monitoring and reporting is provided to the public on our transparency page at https://usyc.hashnote.com/ and is always available via Etherscan.

We are also currently onboarding with the Chainlink Proof of Reserve to enable the reliable and timely monitoring of reserve assets. Jiritsu is also working on proof of reserves reports for USYC.

3. Describe the accounting and auditing processes for the portfolio and product The daily price of USYC is set internally by Hashnote at 7 am Eastern, based on the Net Asset Value (NAV) of the Prime Brokerage account divided by the total USYC supply. NAV Fund Services (Cayman) Ltd manages the accounting, tracking on-chain activity to update the share registry. Cohen & Co International audits the fund’s books and records to validate year-end statements.

4. Describe the technical implementation of your product Here’s a summary of the USYC infrastructure, which focuses on scalability, security, and compliance:

On-Chain Overview:

Flexible smart contracts allow for upgrades, with key functions like minting, burning, and managing the Entitlements securely controlled by Hashnote to maintain compliance.

  • Entitlements Investors who pass KYC/AML checks have their wallet addresses receive entitlements, enabling them to interact with USYC. Entitlements are the gatekeepers to most of the functionality of USYC. The wallets associated with KYC’ed entities receive a Role that entitles them to mint, hold, transfer, and burn the token.The USYC Smart Contracts queries the Entitlements contract to verify the caller of a transaction has the appropriate permissions to perform a transaction.

In addition to checking that a wallet is permissioned, the Entitlements contract also performs OFAC sanctions checks by querying an on-chain oracle for matches to sanctioned addresses. The oracle is maintained by Chainalysis.

  • Minting & Burning Hashnote mints new USYC tokens when investors subscribe manually (via Fiat or stables). Investors can burn their tokens or submit a request to Hashnote to initiate redemption.

Tellers offer 24/7 subscriptions and redemption capability. Redemptions are subject to liquidity (see Teller section for more details)

  • Transfers & Oracle USYC tokens can be transferred between whitelisted addresses, and asset prices are regularly updated via an Oracle feed. Prices are reported once per business day.
usyc.docs.hashnote.com

Token Price | USYC

Additional Technical Products and Services:

  • Onboarding Tool: A proprietary tool simplifies investor onboarding for a seamless experience.
  • Investor Portal: Provides real time portfolio information such as NAV, token holdings, and historical transactions.
  • Fireblocks: Hashnote utilizes MPC wallets managed via Fireblocks to secure admin controls, transaction approvals, and other on-chain operations.
  • Internal Reconciliation & Public Website: Daily reconciliation ensures accuracy, while the public website provides key information on yield and NAV for investors.

5. What audits have been performed on the smart contracts involved with your product, by whom, and when? Hashnote has engaged several independent auditors to review our smart contracts. The audits have been completed by Sentnl and ChainSafe as well as an independent security researcher Anton Cheng.

VI. MakerDAO Ecosystem

1. Describe any previous relationship with MakerDAO and familiarity working with DAOs We submitted an application to MakerDao offering USYC instead of WBTC addressing the community’s risk concerns.

2. Beyond yield, how might your product benefit the SparkDAO and/or MakerDAO ecosystem? Hashnote is approaching Maker with longevity and stability and mind, and we believe that introducing Hashnote USYC is fully aligned with “The Endgame Plan” proposed by Rune Christensen.

  1. Integrating Hashnote USYC supports this strategy by increasing the share of Real-World Assets (RWA) as collateral, thereby reducing dependence on USDC and significantly improving the profit and loss margin of MakerDAO. Dai can best scale its usage and maintain its peg by issuing against non-correlated, yield bearing, and reliable assets.
  2. A strategic partnership with Hashnote expands Maker growth opportunities by tapping into a larger and more stable addressable market: professional and institutional crypto investors and tradfi community alike. Unlike other yield-bearing tokens, Hashnote USYC use-case goes beyond treasury management savings vehicle. USYC is designed and is growing to be the universally accepted collateral token accepted by centralised and decentralised exchanges as well as lending and custody providers and further down the line should be introduced to venues like CME to further enhance collateral efficiency in the tradfi space.
  3. Through this strategic partnership, Hashnote community and its stakeholders are likely to be attracted to Spark, which would positively impact the growth of SparkLend. Hashnote is actively working on launching multiple lending products in collaboration with centralised venues, attracting professional investors and large institutional clients. We anticipate that this will bring a similar user base to the MakerDAO ecosystem, positioning it as a gateway into DeFi for users who haven’t explored DeFi yet.
  4. Hashnote fully addresses and safeguards the concerns of the Maker community while ensuring legal recognition of their assets. The Hashnote team comes with extensive experience in traditional finance and aims to leverage the transparency and credibility offered by blockchain technology to bridge the gap between on-chain and off-chain asset representations.
  5. With Hashnote’s expertise in tokenization, Maker Governance can gain a powerful gateway to engage in “real-world” activities. We fully agree that DeFi requires a foundational layer of collateral anchored to more stable, secular supply and demand dynamics, and RWAs are a crucial step toward achieving this vision.

3. Does the product have integrations with any other platforms? Morpho is a lending protocol that enhances capital efficiency by optimising yields on lending pools. Hashnote USYC serves as collateral on the Morpho platform for the Steakhouse PYUSD vault, making it the key venue for borrowing and lending PYUSD on Ethereum mainnet and offering one of the most efficient environments for PYUSD lending.

This partnership allows users to earn higher yields compared to traditional DeFi lending protocols by leveraging the stability and potential returns of tokenized Real-World Assets (RWAs). Additionally, the collaboration attracts institutional clients to DeFi by combining Morpho’s efficient lending mechanisms with Hashnote’s regulated, tokenized products, providing a strong value proposition for large-scale investors.

4. Do you offer or plan to offer other products that could be appropriate for Spark or other SubDAOs? Yes, Hashnote is a diversified asset manager that continuously launches new products. We are always exploring opportunities to offer innovative solutions that could be suitable for Spark or other SubDAOs. As we develop new offerings, we will actively engage with the DAO to understand their specific needs and collaborate on potential opportunities.

Thank you for your attention.

item.title: Tokenization Grand Prix Application - Spiko (USTBL)
item.dc:creator: pahyppolite
item.description:
I. Product Summary

  1. Project name

Spiko.

  1. Product name

Spiko US T-Bills Money Market Fund (”USTBL” or the “Fund”), a sub-fund of the Spiko SICAV.

N.B.: throughout the application, we may use “USTBL” to refer either to the fund shares or to the Fund itself when the context leaves no room for ambiguity.

  1. Product type / underlying asset

Product type: Short-Term Variable Net Asset Value MMF UCITS approved by the French Financial Markets Authority under the UCITS Directive (Directive - 2009/65/EC) and the MMF Regulation (Regulation (EU) 2017/1131).

Underlying assets: Treasury Bills issued by the U.S. Department of the Treasury, (Reverse) Repurchase Agreements, Bank Deposits.

N.B.: the portfolio’s weighted average maturity is capped at 60 days (hence: max duration = 2 months).

  1. Issuer jurisdiction

France.

  1. Product website

www.spiko.xyz

  1. Primary contact name, title, and method of contact

Name: Paul-Adrien Hyppolite.

Title: Co-founder & CEO at Spiko and chairman of the board of directors of the Spiko SICAV.

Email: pah@spiko.finance

Telegram & Twitter: @pahyppolite

Forum Username: @pahyppolite

II. Company Details

  1. Company description

Spiko is a Paris-based startup building and operating a platform for issuing, managing, and distributing tokenized funds. Spiko aims to become the foremost financial market infrastructure, enabling the native issuance and management of all types of financial instruments on blockchain networks.

Throughout 2023 and the first half of 2024, Spiko spearheaded and oversaw the project that led to the launch of the first Ethereum-native USD- and EUR-denominated Money Market Funds (MMFs) approved in the European Union. Shares of the Spiko MMFs, launched to the public in mid-June 2024, are exclusively issued as ERC-20 tokens on Ethereum and EVM-compatible networks.

Three months after their launch, the Spiko MMFs have amassed $92M in assets under management, handled $135M in investment and redemption flows, and generated over $300K in interest. Consequently, Spiko has quickly become one of the leading tokenizers of T-Bills, with its tokenized MMFs experiencing the fastest growth in the sector in recent weeks (source).

Spiko developed and maintains the transfer agent software used to manage the Spiko MMFs on-chain. The Funds are distributed by Spiko Finance, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Spiko that is regulated as an investment adviser in France.

Both Spiko and Spiko Finance are French simplified join-stock companies (société par actions simplifiée or “SAS” under French law). The Spiko SICAV, which is the legal entity that issues and manages the Spiko MMFs, is completely separate from Spiko and Spiko Finance. The Spiko SICAV is owned by token holders, with each token representing a share in the Spiko MMFs.

  1. Key personnel biographies

Paul-Adrien Hyppolite is the co-founder and CEO of Spiko. Former deputy head of the French Treasury’s financial markets division. Paul-Adrien has several years of experience in finance and financial regulation, having worked at Lazard, Antin, and the European Commission. He graduated in Economics and Finance from the Ecole Normale Supérieure and the Corps des Mines.

Antoine Michon is the co-founder and COO of Spiko. Former ministerial advisor to the French Government on the digital transformation of public services. Antoine also worked at Palantir Technologies as a deployment strategist. He graduated in Applied Mathematics from the Ecole Polytechnique and the Corps des Mines.

Samuel Briole is the CTO of Spiko. Samuel worked as a senior software engineer in several start-ups including P00ls and Inato. He graduated in Physics from Ecole Polytechnique and in Quantum Physics from the Ecole Normale Supérieure.

  1. Team size

8 employees

  1. Years in operation

1.5 year

III. Product Information

  1. Describe the product

The Spiko US T-Bills Money Market Fund is a sub-fund of the Spiko SICAV.

A SICAV (which stands for “Société d’Investissement à Capital Variable”) is a European investment fund structure akin to a U.S. open-end mutual fund, allowing investors to subscribe to and redeem shares while the fund’s assets are professionally managed.

Incorporated in France under French law, the Spiko SICAV currently manages two sub-funds approved by the French Financial Markets Authority (Autorité des Marchés Financiers) as short-term variable net asset value MMFs under the UCITS Directive (Directive 2009/65/EC) and the MMF Regulation (Regulation (EU) 2017/1131).

UCITS (which stands for “Undertakings for Collective Investment in Transferable Securities”) funds are the European Union’s equivalent to U.S. mutual funds. Before a UCITS can be marketed to investors, its prospectus must be approved by a national competent authority of the European Union. This process is similar to that of a mutual fund’s approval by the SEC in the United States.

To the best of our knowledge, Spiko US T-Bills Money Market Fund is the world’s first public money market fund whose shares (USTBL) are natively issued as ERC-20 tokens on Ethereum. N.B.: in this context, ‘public,’ as opposed to ‘private,’ means that the Fund is approved for distribution to the general public, including retail (i.e. non-professional, non-accredited or non-qualified) investors.

The Fund’s prospectus references the smart contract that officially serves as the shareholder register: 0xe4880249745eAc5F1eD9d8F7DF844792D560e750. As a result, the blockchain acts as the definitive source of truth for the shareholder register, rather than simply being an on-chain copy of a separate centralized database. The Fund’s shares (USTBL) can be custodied at investors’ discretion using any wallet technology compatible with the Ethereum Virtual Machine.

The following table summarizes the key characteristics of the Spiko US T-Bills Money Market Fund.

Spiko US T-Bills MMF (USTBL)
ISIN FR001400ODM9
Bloomberg ticker SPKUSMM
Currency $ USD
Type of fund UCITS short-term VNAV Money Market Fund under EU law
Fund domicile France
National competent authority French Financial Markets Authority (AMF)
Legal structure SICAV
Investment policy T-Bills issued by the U.S. Treasury
Benchmark Effective Federal Funds Rate (EFFR)
Maximum weighted average maturity 60 days
Use of income Accumulating
Fees Management fees: 0.30% (per annum, deducted daily on a prorata basis). Admin. fees: current charge of 0.10% (per annum, deducted daily on a prorata basis). This charge will be reduced to 8 bps at $100m AuM and 5 bps at $500m AuM. Subscription / redemption fees: 0.00% (none).
Available networks Ethereum, Polygon PoS
Public address of the shareholder register 0xe4880249745eAc5F1eD9d8F7DF844792D560e750
Minimum subscription amount 1,000 USD (then 1 USD)
Minimum redemption amount 1 USD
Max. subscription and redemption amount None
  1. Describe the underlying asset

The Fund’s portfolio is invested in:

  • USD-denominated T-Bills issued by the U.S. Department of the Treasury, with a maturity of less than 6 months (N.B.: BNY Mellon has been appointed by the Fund’s depositary bank as the custodian for the U.S. T-Bills),
  • Repos or reverse repos backed by U.S. Government securities.

The Fund maintains a USD balance at its correspondent bank for liquidity management purposes, which cannot exceed 10% of its portfolio (N.B.: the USD correspondent bank appointed by the Fund’s depositary bank is JPMorgan Chase - New York).

The portfolio’s total maximum weighted average maturity is 60 days. N.B.: this 60 days limit is a regulatory requirement resulting from the Fund’s approval as a short-term variable net asset value MMF under EU law. As a result, the Fund’s depositary bank has a regulatory responsibility to ensure that the duration cap is adhered to, providing investors with a high level of assurance that it will be upheld.

The Fund is prohibited from holding stablecoins, effectively eliminating any exposure in its portfolio to depeg risk.

As of September 13th, 2024, the underlying assets weighted average maturity is ~26 days and the Fund’s holdings are the following:

Name ISIN Maturity % Portfolio
U.S. Treasury Bill expiring on 29 October 2024 US912797LV78 46 days 18.83%
U.S. Treasury Bill expiring on 22 October 2024 US912797LU95 39 days 18.44%
U.S. Treasury Bill expiring on 19 September 2024 US912797KL06 6 days 14.37%
U.S. Treasury Bill expiring on 26 September 2024 US912797KM88 13 days 13.46%
U.S. Treasury Bill expiring on 10 October 2024 US912797KT32 27 days 9.59%
U.S. Treasury Bill expiring on 17 October 2024 US912797KU05 34 days 9.58%
Current account in USD held at CACEIS Bank, a subsidiary of Crédit Agricole - 0 day 8.56%
U.S. Treasury Bill expiring on 03 October 2024 US912797GW17 20 days 7.17%

The exhaustive list of assets held in the portfolio is updated daily and can be viewed here: Funds | Spiko.

  1. How is yield transferred to the tokenholder (i.e., via rebasing, distributions, price accrual, etc.) and how often?

The Spiko US T-Bills Money Market Fund is an accumulating fund, meaning its returns are automatically reinvested rather than paid out to investors. This reinvestment boosts the value of each investor’s holdings over time, without any cash distributions. As a result, investors benefit from compound growth, as the reinvested earnings generate additional returns.

By reinvesting earnings, the Fund’s net asset value (NAV) increases, along with the value of each investor’s share.

The Fund’s NAV is calculated every business day of the Paris Stock Exchange by an industry leader (CACEIS Fund Administration).

  1. What is the jurisdiction of the issuer and key entities?

Issuer: Spiko SICAV - France

Key stakeholders/entities are the following:

  • Bank: CACEIS Bank - France
  • Correspondent bank: JPMorgan Chase New York - United States
  • Custodian: CACEIS Bank - France
  • Sub-custodian: BNY Mellon - United States
  • Fund admin: CACEIS Fund Administration - France
  • Asset manager: Twenty First Capital - France
  • Distributor: Spiko Finance - France
  • Auditor: PwC - France
  1. What is the asset eligibility criteria and/or concentration limitations for the portfolio as defined by the underlying documents?
Weighted Average Maturity 60 days or less
1-day liquidity Greater than or equal to 7.5% of net assets
7-day liquidity Greater than or equal to 15% of net assets
Maximum residual life of securities 6 months
Type of assets USD-denominated Treasury Bills issued by the U.S. Department of the Treasury; Repos & Reverse repos backed by U.S. Government Securities
Maximum bank deposits Up to 10% of net assets
Assets minimum rating Investment Grade: AAA to BBB- on the Standard & Poor’s scale (or equivalent)
  1. Are any hedging or derivatives permitted in the underlying portfolio?

None, as specified in the Fund’s prospectus available here.

  1. Provide a list of all counterparties and service providers used by your product (i.e., custodians, trustees, reporting agents, exchange agents, banks, etc). Provide flow-charts or diagrams for all related entities and counterparties, if available.

Distributor & Tech provider:

Spiko Finance is an investment adviser, registered under number 23008251 in the French single register of insurance, banking, and finance intermediaries.

Custodian and Fund Valuation:

CACEIS Bank is a depositary bank, approved and supervised by the French Prudential Supervision and Resolution Authority (ACPR) and the French Financial Markets Authority (AMF). CACEIS is the custody and asset servicing arm of Crédit Agricole and Santander, two globally systemic banks. It is one of the world’s largest custodians, with over $5 trillion in assets under custody. N.B.: the regulatory duties of a UCITS fund’s depositary bank include safeguarding the fund’s assets and ensuring the investment manager’s decisions comply with the prospectus.

The Bank of New York Mellon has been appointed by CACEIS Bank as its sub-custodian for the U.S. Treasury Bills. BNY Mellon is the world’s largest custodian, overseeing over $40 trillion in assets under custody.

JPMorgan Chase is CACEIS Bank’s correspondent bank for USD holdings and transfers. JPMorgan Chase is the largest bank in the United States and one of the world’s largest banks by balance sheet size.

Asset Manager:

Twenty First Capital (TFC) is a portfolio management company, approved and supervised by the French Financial Markets Authority (AMF), with over $3 billion in assets under management. Its mandate is to manage the portfolio of T-Bills of the Spiko US T-Bills MMF.

Fund Auditor:

PricewaterhouseCoopers Audit (PwC) is an auditor, approved and supervised by the French High Counsel of Statutory Auditors (H3C).

On-ramp / Off-ramp:

In the European Union, on- & off-ramp services are regulated and require a CASP (Crypto Asset Service Provider) license under the so-called MiCA Regulation. To date, neither Spiko nor Spiko Finance hold a CASP registration or license. We partner with several CASPs to provide these services to our clients.

According to Sky’s preferences, Spiko can either offer top-tier partners or work with Sky’s preferred partner(s) to provide on/off-ramp services necessary for facilitating subscriptions and redemptions in the Fund using stablecoins.

Private Key Services:

  • Admin multisig: Safe + Ledger
  • Daily fund operations: OpenZeppelin Defender

  1. What is the AUM of the product? Provide a breakdown by blockchain

As of September 13th, 2024, the Fund’s AuM is $38.95M, of which:

  • $38,150,702 (i.e. 37,550,995 outstanding shares) on Ethereum.
  • $799,298 (i.e. 786,733 outstanding shares) on Polygon PoS.
  1. What are the standard fees (i.e., investment, redemption, management, etc.)?
Operations Fee schedule
Investment Free
Redemption Free
Asset management fees 0.30% per annum
Administrative fees Current charge of 0.10% (per annum, deducted daily on a prorata basis). We will be able to lower this charge to 8 bps at $100m AuM and to 5 bps at $500m AuM.
  1. Other than the fees described above, can other expenses be paid from the proceeds of the product/assets?

There are no other fees, apart from the network gas fees.

Network gas fees

  • Allowlist: Spiko pays the gas fees.
  • Investment: Spiko pays the gas fees.
  • Redemption: Sky pays the gas fees (token transfer).
  • Transfer on-chain to another entity: Sky pays the gas fees (token transfer).
  1. How is your product permissioned? (e.g., primary users, secondary users)

Before investing in the Fund, investors must complete Spiko Finance’s KYC/AML process. As a regulated entity, Spiko Finance complies with European anti-money laundering (AML) and counter-terrorist financing (CTF) regulations.

Our ERC-20s are permissioned and investors need to be allowlisted to own and transfer the token. The allowlist is persisted on a PermissionManager contract which is managed by Spiko Finance. The connections between Ethereum accounts and investors’ real-world identities are stored off-chain.

Anonymous ownership of fund shares is not permitted in France, as in all major financial jurisdictions. This is the reason why USTBL can only be held by - and transferred between - allowlisted addresses.

  1. What is the monthly transaction volume for the product?

As of September 13th, 2024, the monthly subscription and redemption volumes of the Fund were $36,563,569, including 31 transactions.

  1. What is the expected and maximum time for users to subscribe to and redeem from your product? Have you had any interruptions in your ability to process redemptions and subscriptions?

The Spiko MMFs’ prospectus stipulates that investors are entitled to daily subscriptions and redemptions. Besides, all investors must be treated equitably, without any possibility of discrimination.

The Spiko MMFs process subscriptions and redemptions every business day of the Paris Stock Exchange at a regular cut-off time of 10:30 AM CET. Subscription and redemption orders are always executed based on the net asset value (NAV) calculated from the previous day.

The funds currently operate with a ‘pre-funding’ model, meaning they wait for cash to be received in the depositary bank before executing subscriptions.

To date, we have processed $104,069,422 in subscriptions and $12,550,557 in redemptions, and we have consistently maintained uninterrupted processing throughout.

  1. Provide a description of the subscription and redemption process. Include a diagram of the flow of funds, including each party involved.

Subscription and redemption orders are directly initiated on Spiko’s web platform, via API or on-chain (for redemptions only at this point). The Fund currently accepts USD for subscriptions and redemptions, with EUR to be added soon. On-ramping and off-ramping are facilitated through partnering Crypto Asset Service Providers (CASPs).

Subscription Flow

Redemption Flow

  1. Have any liquidity vehicles been established to enhance redemption and subscription efficiency? If so, describe how they work.

We have developed a secondary market contract which we call the ATM , allowing allowlisted investor to buy/sell fund shares in the secondary market at the latest available net asset value (NAV) of USTBL. Up to the liquidity depth of such contract, it gives investor instant liquidity on-chain for their USTBL against stablecoin. At this point, we plan on seeding the ATM with up to $2M of liquidity. We are open to discussing plans with the Sky ecosystem to do much more.

  1. With what product can subscriptions and redemptions be made? (i.e., fiat, Dai, USDC, etc.)

Investments and redemptions are available in USD or stablecoins (USDC, USDT, or DAI/USDS) through partnering CASPs.

  1. What are your future development plans for the product?

Key development plans include enhancing USTBL’s on-chain liquidity and utility, such as its use as collateral in DeFi and CeFi.

IV. Legal Structure

  1. Explain the legal structure of the product and the jurisdictions in which it operates

The Spiko US T-Bills Money Market Fund is a sub-fund of a SICAV incorporated in France under French law (the “Spiko SICAV”).

The Spiko US T-Bills Money Market Fund is approved by the French Financial Markets Authority (AMF) as a UCITS short-term variable net asset value Money Market Fund (short-term VNAV MMF) under the UCITS Directive (Directive 2009/65/EC) and the MMF Regulation (Regulation (EU) 2017/1131).

The UCITS Directive (Directive 2009/65/EC) and the MMF Regulation (Regulation (EU) 2017/1131) impose several investor protection measures on fund managers, including the requirement for a depositary bank and adherence to stringent liquidity ratios for MMF assets.

  1. What regulatory bodies oversee the product?

The French Financial Markets Authority (Autorité des marchés financiers).

  1. What licenses, permits, certificates, authorizations, registrations, concessions, approvals, exemptions does your product or company hold?

The Spiko US T-Bills Money Market Fund is approved as a short-term variable net asset value (short-term VNAV) Money Market Fund under the UCITS Directive (Directive - 2009/65) and the MMF Regulation (Regulation (EU) 2017/1131).

It is a fully licensed product approved for public distribution.

  1. How is bankruptcy remoteness established for assets of this product? Does the issuer have more than one product? Please provide separately any related legal opinions or supplementary documents regarding bankruptcy remoteness

As a UCITS fund, the Spiko US T-Bills Money Market Fund adheres to all the requirements set forth by the UCITS Directive. One such requirement is the appointment of a depositary (or custodian) responsible for safeguarding the Fund’s assets, monitoring cash flows, and overseeing the Fund manager’s duties.

Below, we outline the impact on investors in the event of a bankruptcy of any stakeholder involved in the Fund’s operations.

  • Bankruptcy of Spiko Finance (Investment Adviser & Tech Provider)

As a regulated investment adviser under French law, Spiko Finance is prohibited from handling investors’ money. At no time (not even for the briefest moment) can investors’ money be on Spiko Finance’s balance sheet. Investors’ funds are fully safeguarded from the risk of Spiko Finance’s bankruptcy.

  • Bankruptcy of Twenty First Capital (Asset Manager)

Twenty First Capital’s role is to select the U.S. T-Bills that are bought or sold daily in line with subscription and redemption activity. As a regulated portfolio management company under EU law, Twenty First Capital is prohibited from handling investors’ money. At no time (not even for the briefest moment) can investors’ money be on Twenty First Capital’s balance sheet. Investors’ funds are fully safeguarded from the risk of Twenty First Capital’s bankruptcy. If Twenty First Capital were to go bankrupt, the Spiko SICAV would seek a new asset manager to take over the management of the Fund. In the event that no asset manager is found, the Fund would be closed, and all assets would be returned to the investors.

  • Bankruptcy of CACEIS Bank (Depositary / Custodian Bank)

CACEIS Bank is the depositary of the Spiko US T-Bills Money Market Fund. According to the UCITS Directive, the assets of a UCITS are required to be entrusted to a depositary for safe-keeping. The depositary must hold in custody all financial instruments. It must also ensure that, in the event of its own insolvency or that of any of its sub-custodians, the UCITS assets held in custody are ring-fenced, meaning they are protected from being used to satisfy the creditors of the depositary or its sub-custodians.

  • Bankruptcy of CACEIS Fund Administration (Valuator)

In the event of CACEIS Fund Administration’s bankruptcy, the Spiko SICAV would appoint a new fund valuator.

  • Bankruptcy of PricewaterhouseCoopers (Auditor)

In the event of PwC’s bankruptcy, the Spiko SICAV would appoint a new fund auditor.

  1. What rights do tokenholders have?

USTBL are shares of the Spiko US T-Bills Money Market Fund.

Ownership of USTBL confers voting rights at Spiko SICAV’s general shareholders’ meeting. USTBL holders, for instance, vote to elect the board of directors, who are tasked with safeguarding shareholders’ interests

  1. Are there any pending or threatened legal proceedings or investigations against the company or any of its officers?

No.

  1. Describe any conflicts of interest the company or product may have with its officers or MakerDAO

None.

  1. Explain the potential tax implications associated with the product

The SICAV itself is not subject to taxation. Shareholders may be subject to taxes on realized or unrealized capital gains from their investment in the SICAV, depending on the tax regulations in their place of residence.

Spiko has a memo from a leading international law firm explaining that the SICAV is a tax-transparent vehicle, and that investors are not subject to French taxation if they are not tax residents in France. Besides, they are not required to file any reports with the French tax authorities.

V. Performance, Reporting, and Technical

  1. Provide historical performance relative to the most relevant benchmark and explanations for any deviations from the benchmark

The Fund’s management objective is to deliver a net performance, after fees, in line with the federal funds rate (EFFR).

As of September 13th, 2024, the annualized return of the Fund over the last 31 days, net of fees, is 5.07%.

Since the Fund’s public launch on June 12, 2024, the NAV of USTBL has grown as follows:

N.B.: the irregularity in the curve visible at the end of August corresponds to a time of large subscriptions that multiplied the size of the fund by more than 15x.

  1. Describe the frequency, content, and process for performance and portfolio transparency reports. Who provides these?

The Fund Administrator (CACEIS Fund Administration, one of the largest FA globally) is responsible for the Fund’s net asset value (NAV) computation on each business day (opening days of the Paris Stock Exchange).

According to the UCITS Directive and MMF Regulation, the NAV is computed by the Fund Administrator using a mark-to-market valuation approach. Once computed, the NAV of the Fund is double-checked independently by the Asset Manager. Once this check is done, the daily NAV is confirmed and final.

The Fund Administrator is then responsible for reporting the NAV to the regulatory authorities (Autorité des marchés financiers) and broadcasting it to major TradFi data providers (like Bloomberg or Morningstar).

The NAV is also updated daily on crypto data feed providers (like CoinGecko).

Spiko updates daily on www.spiko.xyz the Fund’s portfolio and its AuM.

  1. Describe the accounting and auditing processes for the portfolio and product

The Fund Administrator manages daily accounting and bookkeeping duties, which are performed just before the calculation of the Fund’s Net Asset Value (NAV).

Biannual independent financial audits are conducted by PwC, a UCITS-approved auditor recognized by regulatory authorities. These audits ensure compliance with regulatory standards and financial accuracy.

Annual accounts are approved by shareholders (i.e. USTBL holders) at the Spiko SICAV’s general assembly of shareholders.

  1. Describe the technical implementation of your product

Shares of the Spiko US T-Bills Money Market Fund (MMF) are issued as ERC-20 tokens, utilizing OpenZeppelin’s implementation. The token is compatible with ERC-1363, ERC-2612, and ERC-2771 standards, also leveraging OpenZeppelin’s implementation. The source code for the Token contract is available here.

The investor allowlist is managed by a separate smart contract called PermissionManager (source code available here). This manager is shared across all Spiko products, including the Spiko EU T-Bills Money Market Fund.

Upon subscription to the Fund, shares are minted directly to the investor’s address. For redemptions, investors transfer their tokens to a Redemption contract (source code available here). Redemptions are processed daily, and upon execution, the tokens are burned within the Redemption contract.

The token’s NAV is published daily on-chain via an Oracle contract (source code available here). Currently, we handle this daily publication ourselves. However, we have signed an agreement with a leading oracle provider who source the NAV data directly from the Fund Administrator and publish it on-chain, eliminating our involvement in this process. This will be announced in the coming days.

  1. What audits have been performed on the smart contracts involved with your product, by whom, and when?

Spiko’s smart contract code has been audited by Trail of Bits in October 2023.

A detailed report can be accessed here.

VI. MakerDAO Ecosystem

  1. Describe any previous relationship with MakerDAO and familiarity working with DAOs

Investors in the Spiko MMFs include numerous Web3 for-profits and non-profits that use USTBL and/or EUTBL to earn daily returns at the USD or EUR risk-free rate on their treasury holdings, and manage on/off-ramps between traditional banking and modern blockchain rails. Spiko has already onboarded Web3 foundations as well as DAOs.

Besides, Spiko maintains close relationships with several decentralized organizations, especially in the DeFi space, and aims to further its presence in this sector. The Spiko SICAV’s board of directors, which includes independent members who are leaders of prominent DeFi protocols such as Morpho, is a testament to Spiko’s Web3 DNA.

  1. Beyond yield, how might your product benefit the SparkDAO and/or MakerDAO ecosystem?

Beyond being a reliable revenue source to the Sky ecosystem, USTBL would provide several additional benefits.

  • Firstly, USTBL would mitigate the counterparty risk in Sky’s reserves. USTBL is operated by top-tier financial services firms, with assets held with the world’s largest custodians. Owning a portfolio of T-Bills held in custody, rather than being exposed to the counterparty risk of an issuer (whether it’s a stablecoin issuer or an SPV), would be valuable for the Sky ecosystem. Importantly, USTBL is also completely insulated from crypto market dynamics because the Fund does not hold crypto-assets on its balance sheet. For instance, USTBL is entirely shielded from the risk of a stablecoin depegging.

  • Secondly, USTBL would provide the Sky ecosystem with exceptional legal protection and regulatory clarity on its reserves. USTBL is a regulated product, approved in the largest asset management jurisdiction in continental Europe, and governed by some of the most protective investor rules globally (e.g. the UCITS Directive and the MMF Regulation). USTBL is authorized for public distribution, ensuring the highest level of disclosure through a prospectus that cannot be modified without the regulator’s approval. Importantly, USTBL is also issued in a jurisdiction that recognizes blockchains (incl. public ones such as Ethereum) as the primary source of truth for the shareholder register.

  • Thirdly, USTBL would provide the Sky ecosystem with oversight and voting rights in the governance of the tokenized T-Bills held in its reserves. Sky would indeed have voting rights at the Spiko SICAV’s general shareholders’ meeting in proportion to its USTBL holdings. Besides, a representative from the Sky ecosystem could join the board of the SICAV issuing USTBL if elected by the general assembly of shareholders.

  • Finally, UTSBL would grant Sky direct access to the issuer of a key asset in its reserves for subscriptions and redemptions in both fiat (USD) and stablecoins (USDC, USDT, USDS). USTBL are minted or burned once per business day around 10:30 AM CET at the previous day’s NAV.

  1. Does the product have integrations with any other platforms?

Currently, USTBL (as well as EUTBL, our EUR-denominated tokenized MMF) is held in the treasury of many Web3 organizations but are not yet integrated into DeFi protocols. We have a roadmap to develop these integrations in the coming months.

  1. Do you offer or plan to offer other products that could be appropriate for Spark or other SubDAOs?

Spiko’s setup is advantageous because it is regulator-approved and extremely flexible for launching new products. We could envision launching any type of fund as a new sub-fund of the Spiko SICAV to meet the needs of the Sky ecosystem, including Spark or any other SubDAO.

Documentation

  • Spiko Docs
  • Spiko On-chain Addresses
  • Spiko Smart Contracts
  • Spiko SICAV Prospectus
  • UTSBL shareholder register on Etherscan
  • USTBL shareholder register on Polygonscan

item.title: 2nd Notice - Attention WBTC Vault and WBTC SparkLend Users
item.dc:creator: ecosystem-team
item.description:
This is the second official notice from the Sky Ecosystem regarding the offboarding of WBTC-A, WBTC-B, WBTC-C, and WBTC on SparkLend.

A proposal to offboard WBTC collateral exposure from the Sky Ecosystem, including Legacy Vault Types and SparkLend, has been initiated by @BA-Labs.

According to the proposal, the offboarding will be conducted in several steps over multiple Executive Votes. The process is expected to start in the Executive Vote on September 26, 2024.

Pending Governance approval, if you want to avoid liquidation, please close your WBTC Legacy Vaults and WBTC positions in SparkLend.

Further information may be found here: WBTC Changes and Risk Mitigation - 10 August 2024 - #26 by monet-supply

item.title: Tokenization Grand Prix Application - Centrifuge
item.dc:creator: Centrifuge
item.description:
To view the recommended PDF version of this application, please see here.

0. Executive Summary

Our proposal, presented by Centrifuge in collaboration with Anemoy and two additional market-leading strategic partners, is carefully tailored to align with Sky’s core principles and address all of its requirements. Our aim is to be the full-service white glove partner of Sky, providing our technology, resources, brand, and traditional finance strategic partnerships to the benefit of the ecosystem.

What We’re Proud to Bring to Spark:

Horizontal and Vertical Integration: Centrifuge provides asset-agnostic infrastructure designed to support any RWA use case. Anemoy leverages Centrifuge’s technology to onboard asset managers into DeFi, creating seamless integration between conventional finance and decentralized platforms.


Credibility and Expertise: Anemoy has strengthened its Asset Management capabilities by partnering with a $360 billion Traditional Finance asset manager to serve as Portfolio Manager. Our application is backed by exceptional investment management expertise and operational excellence.

Geographic Diversity and Legal Compliance: The Fund is regulated in the British Virgin Islands (BVI), outside U.S. jurisdiction, and is fully bankruptcy-remote and compliant. This structure offers Sky the assurance of both regulatory security and operational integrity.

Competitive Fees: We propose a fee structure of 25 bps, offering significant value without compromising on quality or performance.

Liquidity Built In: Robust liquidity solutions include instant redemptions up to $125M in USDC and native DAI/USDS, designed to support both tactical rebalance requirements of the PSM & strategic growth targets of Sky.


Innovative products: We propose our institutional-grade T-bill token fund that offers the best treasury products in DeFi, plus two more institutional-grade token funds with well known partners in the industry.

Successful Track Record: Centrifuge is one of the few RWA protocols with a proven track record of successful collaboration with Maker/Sky. We were the first to mint a real-world asset for Maker in 2021, and since then, we have collateralized nearly $600M of Dai. Our history of success with Maker/Sky reinforces our commitment and capability to deliver on this proposal.

We are excited about the opportunity to deepen our relationship with Sky and to contribute meaningfully to its mission to build the world’s first unbiased currency and leading decentralized stablecoin.

I. Product Summary

1. Project Name: Centrifuge with Anemoy

2. Product Name: Anemoy Liquid Treasury Fund 1 (the “Fund” or “LTF”), sub-advised by Janus Henderson Investors (JHI) and its wholly owned subsidiary Tabula Investment Management. The Fund name is planned to change to Janus Henderson Anemoy 0-3 month Treasury Fund.

3. Product Type / Underlying Asset: The Fund is a professional, tokenized fund domiciled in the British Virgin Islands (BVI) and licensed by the British Virgin Islands Financial Services Commission (FSC). The fund is meticulously structured to adhere to the highest standards of financial regulation, instilling investor confidence in both the security and compliance of their investment.

The Fund’s issued ERC20 tokens (the “LTF Token”) represent the fund shares, effectively replacing traditional share certificates. These LTF Tokens offer offchain recourse, including in-kind redemptions, providing investors with a seamless and secure experience.

The underlying assets of the Fund consist of U.S. Treasury Bills with maturities ranging from 0 to 3 months, ensuring a stable and low-risk investment profile.

4. Issuer Jurisdiction: British Virgin Islands

5. Product Website:
→ Centrifuge: centrifuge.io
→ Anemoy: anemoy.io
→ LTF Pool: Anemoy Liquid Treasury Fund 1

6. Primary contact name, title, and method of contact:

Lucas Vogelsang, Cofounder of Centrifuge
lucas@centrifuge.foundation

Martin Quensel, Cofounder of Anemoy & Centrifuge
martin@anemoy.io

Anil Sood, Cofounder of Anemoy
anil@anemoy.io

II. Company Details

1. Company description

Centrifuge is a pioneering tokenization protocol founded in 2017, and recognized for coining the term “Real-World Assets”. Centrifuge is uniquely issuer-agnostic, jurisdiction-agnostic, and asset-agnostic, seamlessly integrating into the decentralized finance (DeFi) ecosystem. Centrifuge is an open-source protocol governed and operated by a decentralized autonomous organization (DAO). The Centrifuge DAO is governed by CFG tokenholders through a decentralized governance model, Centrifuge has successfully financed over $640 million worth of assets as of August 2024, establishing itself as a leader in the RWA space.

Anemoy serves an asset management firm powered by Centrifuge technology, founded in 2023 by co-founders Martin Quensel and Anil Sood. Anemoy was established with a clear mission: to advance Centrifuge’s efforts in developing RWA products tailored specifically for bridging the TradFi and DeFi worlds.

Anemoy and Centrifuge support the full lifecycle of onchain asset and fund management to cover the entire value chain;

  • Origination: Centrifuge’s ability to originate and manage assets on a single asset level is unparalleled and allows automated onchain structures and process flows like integrated asset origination, performance tracking of single assets with external oracle support on asset level, asset pricing, asset delinquency and default procedures, and more.
  • Tokenization: Centrifuge’s custom smart contract engine empowers institutions to easily construct portfolios that align precisely with their desired risk profiles while accommodating the unique complexities of their specific markets. This flexibility ensures that institutions can effectively tokenize assets in a manner that meets their strategic objectives.
  • Securitization: Anemoy provides advisory services on the optimal strategies for structuring and securitizing onchain assets. Whether through single-tranche liquid issuances or multi-tranche asset-backed solutions, Anemoy seamlessly integrates Net Asset Values (NAVs), waterfall distributions, asset performance metrics, and more into Centrifuge’s fully automated onchain product, offering a robust and transparent investment vehicle.
  • Management: Anemoy fully manages all aspects of fund operations. Automation is leveraged to enhance reporting cadence and facilitate integration with third-party services, ensuring streamlined and efficient fund and asset management.
  • Distribution: The distribution of onchain funds spans DAOs, DeFi protocols, and traditional finance firms. Anemoy and Centrifuge have a dedicated team of sales specialists with deep asset-specific expertise and technical proficiency, ensuring effective distribution.

Janus Henderson Investors (JHI), a leader in traditional finance managing over $360 billion in assets, will serve as sub-advisor to the Fund. Janus Henderson is a British-American global asset management group headquartered in London. Anemoy benefits from their expertise in Fixed Income and Alternatives.

2. Key personnel biographies

Lucas Vogelsang
Centrifuge Co-founder

  • Serial entrepreneur with 15 years of experience in the software industry as an engineer
  • Led engineering at many startups including CTO & Co-Founder at DeinDeal, a Groupon competitor acquired in 2011 and early engineer Taulia, a supply chain finance fintech acquired by SAP in 2022
  • Lucas Co-founded Centrifuge in 2017, and has been CEO since 2019.

Martin Quensel
Anemoy & Centrifuge Co-founder

  • Serial entrepreneur with 30 years in the software industry
  • Founder, advisor, and angel investor
  • Co-founded the Fintech Taulia before Centrifuge, which revolutionized supply chain finance and was acquired by SAP
  • Co-founder of Centrifuge and Anemoy.

Anil Sood
Anemoy Co-founder

  • ETF, Capital markets & Asset Management leader with 20 years experience
  • Anil has helped to build and run several Institutional cross-asset ETF Market Making franchises including Knight Capital, as part of the listed Derivatives group & was also a partner at Cantor Fitzgerald
  • Anil Previously held roles at HANetf, Goldman Sachs, and Barcap.

Eli Cohen
Centrifuge GC & Anemoy Chief Compliance Officer

  • Corporate lawyer with over 25 years of experience in commercial transactions, financial services, and regulatory matters
  • Worked in Asia, Europe, and the US with companies such as the CME, Euroclear Bank, and SGX
  • In crypto since 2019. Previously with Block.One in Hong Kong.

Bhaji Illuminati
Centrifuge & Anemoy CMO

  • 5x early-stage GTM exec with experience creating categories, building teams and scaling marketplace tech companies from 0 to over a million users
  • Co-creator of the Real-World Asset Summit and Tokenized Asset Coalition

Jeroen Offerijns
Centrifuge CTO

  • Experienced engineering & product leader, with 10+ years of software development experience and co-founder of several startups
  • Co-author of ERC-7540, the asynchronous tokenized vault standard for RWAs

Further Key Anemoy Team Members and Anemoy Advisors

Jason Meads

  • Private equity specialist and board of Funds Patron Capital.
  • Director of Intriva Capital Management (real estate private equity in Europe) and served on the board of Binance (Jersey) for 3 years
  • Jason runs the special situations desk at the Blue Marine Foundation

Sanat Rao

  • Advisor of crypto exchanges, prime brokerage platforms, decentralized finance (DeFI) projects, and real-world asset platforms on blockchain
  • Former General Partner at BlockTower Capital, where he managed the market-neutral crypto fund and focused on early-stage crypto investments
  • Previously the managing director and co-founder at Gamma Point Capital and served as a partner at IDG Ventures

Key Janus Henderson Investors Team Members

Ali Dibadj
Chief Executive Officer, Janus Henderson Investors

  • Ali Dibadj is the Chief Executive Officer of Janus Henderson Investors and has been an executive director of Janus Henderson since June 2022
  • Ali leads the firm’s Executive Committee and is responsible for the strategic direction and overall day-to-day management of Janus Henderson.

Nick Cherney, CFA
Head of Innovation, Janus Henderson Investors

  • Helps the firm and its clients to identify, understand, and execute on longer horizon developments that potentially disrupt the way business is managed, and clients manage their investments
  • Leads exchange traded funds (ETF) business also
  • Portfolio manager at Barclays Global Investors managing over US$25 billion of ETF assets before.

Jim Cielinski, CFA
Global Head of Fixed Income, Janus Henderson Investors

  • Leading Fixed Income since 2017
  • Oversees all of the global fixed-income products and teams
  • Leads Corporate Credit as well
  • Previously, Jim was the global head of fixed income for Columbia Threadneedle Investments from 2010.

Michael John (MJ) Lytle
Chief Executive Officer, Tabula Investment Management

  • Joined Tabula 2018 and brings over 30 years of financial industry experience
  • Previously founding partner in Source, an investment manager focused on the creation and distribution of ETFs, including a partnership with PIMCO to create and distribute a range of fixed income ETFs, and purchased by Invesco in 2017
  • Prior to Source, MJ spent 18 years at Morgan Stanley with a variety of roles across corporate finance, capital markets origination, trading, sales, equity, fixed income, private wealth and technology strategy.

Rhys Petheram
Chief Investment Officer, Tabula Investment Management

  • Joined Tabula in 2024 and brings over 20 years of experience in fixed-income and multi-asset investment
  • Most recently Head of the Environmental Investment team and as a Fund Manager at Jupiter Asset Management
  • Over his 17-year tenure at Jupiter, Rhys managed a range of global credit, government bond and multi-asset portfolios for both retail and institutional investors
  • His prior experience includes roles as a fundamental Credit Analyst at Moody’s Investors Service and an Analyst with Towers Perrin in Australia.

Francesco Romano
Head of Risk and Quant, Tabula Investment Management

  • Joined Tabula in 2020 from GFG S.A.M., where he worked on quantitative strategies and UCITS fund risk reporting
  • Prior to this Francesco spent three years at UniCredit Group working on Counterparty Credit and Market Risk
  • Francesco holds an MSc in mathematics from the University of Milan.

Andy Baker
Head of ETF Capital Markets & Portfolio Manager, Tabula Investment Management

  • Joined Tabula in 2018 as Operations Manager
  • Previously spent four years at Morgan Stanley across a range of middle office roles including equity swaps, CDS single name, CDS indices, credit options and structured credit products
  • Andy has a BSc in economics and management from Brunel University.

3. Team size

  • Centrifuge: 30 employees
  • Anemoy: 8 employees

The Anemoy team is led by a highly experienced leadership trio:

  • Martin Quensel (CEO, CPO)
  • Anil Sood (CIO, COO)
  • Jason Meads (Managing Director, Oversight and Strategy)

The team comprises eight core members, covering legal, operational, support, compliance, and communication functions. This ensures robust management and execution across all aspects of the Fund’s operations.

Importantly, as Anemoy is an asset management firm powered by Centrifuge technology. Anemoy also has the entire 30 person team at Centrifuge supporting all aspects of the organization. III. Product Information

1. Describe the product

The Fund is a fully onchain, actively managed fund designed to offer investors stable income the U.S. Treasuries while maximizing liquidity and safeguarding principal. Focused on U.S. Treasury Bills with maturities of less than three months, the fund is tailored for investors who prioritize capital preservation and predictable returns. Additionally, the Fund seamlessly integrates with decentralized finance, enabling composability within the broader onchain ecosystem.

A key differentiator of The Fund is its distinction as the first tokenized fund to be evaluated by leading rating agencies, Moody’s and S&P, alongside the DeFi-native rating agency, Particula. These evaluations are currently under review and are expected to be finalized before the RFP submission deadline, further enhancing the Fund’s credibility and investor confidence.

2. Describe the underlying asset

The Fund will seek to provide a liquid, low risk portfolio through exposure to U.S Treasury Bills (T-bills) with maturities of between 0-3 months. The portfolio is carefully structured to manage yield curve, duration, and liquidity risks.

T-Bills are highly rated short-term debt securities issued by the U.S. Department of the Treasury, with maturities of up to one year. They are widely recognized as one of the safest investment vehicles due to their high credit quality supported by the full faith and credit of the U.S. government. Furthermore, interest rate risk and volatility are low due to the short-term maturity of the instrument.

The fund started with a portfolio T-bills with maturities of between 0-6 months. The portfolio is currently moving to 0-3 months T-bills maturities with a current weighted average maturity (WAM) of 44.5 days already being at the 45 day target.

3. How is yield transferred to the token holder (i.e., via rebasing, distributions, price accrual, etc.) and how often?

The yield generated from the T-Bills is transferred to tokenholders through daily price accrual, which reflects the earned interest directly into the value of the LTF tokens. This daily accrual ensures that the token price accurately represents the cumulative interest earned by the underlying T-Bill portfolio.

IV. Legal Structure

1. Explain the legal structure of the product and the jurisdictions in which it operates

The Fund is established as a BVI professional fund. This legal structure provides the best possible investor protection of any tokenized treasury product currently available. It is the same legal structure used by Blackrock, although that offering has been adapted to be open to US investors while Anemoy is exclusively offshore to avoid potential regulatory risk from the SEC or other US regulators.

The BVI professional fund structure provides direct recourse for investors to the segregated and ring-fenced assets of the Liquid Treasury Fund (i.e., US T-Bills and USD cash) in case of liquidation of the Fund.

Importantly, this direct recourse is enshrined in law rather than a mere contractual right.

This structure is more advantageous for investors than other tokenized treasury products such as SPV/debt offerings or exempt US 3(c)(7) funds.

In the case of products structured as debt offerings issued by an SPV, the investors have no exclusive claim to the assets and will need to prove their claim as against other potential creditors such as tax and other governmental authorities that may have priority. Moreover, as the investors do not have a perfected security interest in the treasuries, the claim may be challenged in court causing an extended timeline for recovery of potentially many years.

In the case of a 3(c)(7) fund, unlike a BVI fund, this is an exempt offering with no oversight by any regulatory authority. Investors’ claims to the underlying assets will be based on contractual terms alone which can be challenged in court leading again to potentially long delays for recovery. Moreover, a US bankruptcy authority would have wide powers including the ability to challenge asset transfers made during a suspect period. This means redemptions from the 3(c)(7) fund occurring up to 90 days prior to bankruptcy can be voided and reversed as the crypto markets have seen occurring with the clawbacks in the Celsius bankruptcy.

4. Describe the technical implementation of your product

The Centrifuge protocol has a few key components:

1. Asset-level tokenization: Centrifuge asset pools are made up of individually tokenized real-world assets. This supports a range of asset types, from Treasury bills such as with the LTF pool, to real-estate assets such as the New Silver pool and ABS such as BlockTower, to any other asset. The asset-level tokenization enables a deep level of transparency and automated reporting for funds building on Centrifuge.
2. Liquidity pools: For each asset pool, there can be liquidity pools, deployed on multiple blockchain networks, and with multiple assets. Today, LTF is live on Ethereum, Base and Celo (more coming), and supports USDC and FRAX. Through this architecture, other assets including USDS can easily be added.
3. ERC-7540 support: Each liquidity pool is fully compliant with the recently finalized asynchronous version of ERC-4626. This standardizes asynchronous investments and redemptions, perfect for RWAs. On top of this, features can be built such as automated allocation management across asset classes, or automated redemptions.

Each fund share is tokenized as a standard ERC-20 token, with transfer restrictions built in (based on the ERC-1404 standard). The restrictions are managed by the fund administrator and stored onchain in a member list contract.

Onchain smart contracts are also used for the entire flow-of-funds, ensuring that funds can only be transferred between investors, the Centrifuge protocol, and the fund’s on/off-ramp accounts.

The price of the ERC-20 token is based on an onchain NAV calculation, which uses the asset-level tokenization to aggregate the prices from the individual assets. The prices are set directly by the fund administrator. Soon, Chronicle will also launch the RWA oracle for the LTF token, which will add additional third-party verification to the NAV & onchain prices.
