Below are a series of proposals that we would like to develop with Sky/Spark, this includes:

Proposal Description Function
PSM INTEGRATION TO SUPPORT RWA TOKENS Centrifuge proposes an enhanced “PSM-like” structure that allows RWA tokens to be swapped for DAI/USDS at the current market price minus a fee. This structure would provide users with instant liquidity, enabling any holder to immediately access DAI or USDS, or convert their DAI/USDS into RWA tokens. By integrating this feature, Centrifuge could significantly enhance liquidity and flexibility within the Sky ecosystem, making it easier for users to interact with real-world assets. Add DAI/USDS utility
DAI/USDS ENABLED SUBSCRIPTIONS AND REDEMPTIONS Enable DAI/USDS for all Centrifuge subscription and redemption activities, streamlining the process for users to engage with RWAs. This feature would simplify transactions within the ecosystem, further integrating DAI/USDS into the broader financial operations of real-world asset management. Add DAI/USDS utility and grow demand
DIVERSIFIED YIELD SOURCES FOR sDAI (RWA sDAI 2.0) Introduce a revamped version of the sDAI savings product, which blends yields from both liquid and illiquid RWA products. This new product, designed with institutional buyers in mind, would be KYC-compliant, allowing Sky to tap into a different segment of capital that requires regulated investment avenues. By expanding the yield offerings in a sustainable and diversified manner, Centrifuge could drive increased demand for DAI/USDS, particularly among institutional investors. Grow demand for DAI/USDS
sDAI TERM BONDS Offer a savings-like structure that locks DAI/USDS for a specified duration, providing a higher yield in return. sDAI Term Bonds would drive demand for DAI/USDS by offering users an attractive, secure investment option with a fixed term. This product would not only diversify the savings options available within the Sky ecosystem but also ensure a steady demand for DAI/USDS over a longer period. Grow demand for DAI/USDS
RWA INTEGRATIONS WITH SPARKLEND Following the success of our Morpho deployment, we propose bringing both similar and unique products to SparkLend to integrate with consumer facing fintechs, and allow Spark to collateralize DAI/USDS with higher yielding assets indirectly through lending markets that otherwise may be too volatile to directly hold. This accomplishes all three of the key objectives and attributes TVL to SparkLend itself. Grow SparkLend user base, add DAI/USDS utility, and grow DAI/USDS demand

Through these product offerings, Centrifuge aims to elevate the Sky/Spark ecosystems by integrating real-world assets in ways that are efficient, transparent, and aligned with the long-term goals of both Sky/Spark and its users. Our commitment to leveraging our extensive experience and resources ensures that these products are not just theoretical but can be successfully implemented to drive meaningful value for the entire ecosystem.

3. Does the product have integrations with any other platforms?

Centrifuge has been a leading force within the industry for RWA integrations, consistently at the forefront of DeFi capabilities. We were the first to launch a tokenized integration with DeFi with the RWA Market back in 2021. Our latest lending market with Morpho, launched in collaboration with other RWA providers, exemplifies our continued commitment to structuring institutional RWA DeFi arrangements onchain.

Some highlights of our integration work:

  • Morpho Market: Our RWA Lending Market on Morpho represents a groundbreaking deal in DeFi, bringing together a range of technologies from tokenization to identity verification, a mix of RWA providers and assets, and a mix of ecosystem capabilities covering L2 networks, externalized risk curation, and DeFi primitives. Built on Coinbase’s Base Layer-2 network, this market allows for the seamless collateralization of RWAs for borrowing. What sets it apart from other efforts in this field is its ability to provide compliant, reliable yield and asset opportunities, in a secure package that appeals to institutional and retail users alike. Built into the market are Coinbase Verifications, a KYC checker built into the Base network, that gate-keep U.S and sanctioned users from lending into the market. This is the first use-case for Verifications in DeFi, furthering the institutional case for finance on smart contract rails.

“The Morpho and Centrifuge integration exemplifies the best our industry has to offer. It successfully combines all of the technologies that we’ve been working for years to bring together - real-world assets, decentralized lending, onchain identity, smart accounts, and open risk curation - it really is the future of finance.”

— Paul Frambot, Morpho

  • Trident Trust: Our latest fund management platform is designed to offer a total solution for credit funds, that seamlessly integrates onchain and offchain data into a unified control panel. Our integration with Trident Trust, an industry leading fund administrator, underscores our platform’s ability to automate reporting, streamline operations, and enhance transparency, making it easier for asset managers to transition to onchain finance. With an integration pipeline that covers custodians, other fund administrators, and more third-parties, our fund management platform is how Centrifuge unlocks transparency and operational efficiencies and brings it to the market.

“We’re excited to work with Anemoy to build one of the first tokenized, regulated funds that maintains an onchain record of portfolio data and net asset valuations. This increases transparency while streamlining typically burdensome reporting and reconciliation processes.”

— David Mungall, Trident Trust

  • Chronicle: The Chronicle RWA oracle has been integrated to provide the most credibly verifiable and transparent price feeds for assets on the Centrifuge platform. Our integration creates verifiability, not just into the total NAV of the fund, but to the entire portfolio of the fund, including granular asset-level details. This enables stakeholders to continuously track, in a trustless manner, the full movements of cash from the onchain USDS and USDC holdings, to offchain cash balances, to the detailed list of holdings at the LTF’s custodian. This creates a level of transparency that is groundbreaking for RWAs in DeFi.

“Our partnership with Centrifuge and Anemoy demonstrates how decentralized oracles can bring a new level of trust and transparency to real-world assets. With Chronicle’s RWA Oracle, investors gain an unopinionated, verifiable view of the LTF, improving their confidence in the asset’s security and stability.”

— Nik Kunkel, Chronicle

  • Archax: Anemoy has entered into an agreement to integrate LTF in the institutional platform of Archax. Archax is the first ever digital securities exchange regulated by the FCA in London. Targeted at institutions, Archax institutional clients will be able to access LTF in the first distribution partnership undertaken by Anemoy. Archax also has its FCA brokerage, custody and crypto permissions.

“We are thrilled to be working with Anemoy, Centrifuge and Janus Henderson to offer our users access to tokenized treasury bills. This collaboration reflects our ongoing mission to integrate real-world assets into the onchain ecosystem, empowering our users to diversify their portfolios with institutional-grade products.”

— Simon Barnby, Archax

We are excited to continue building on this work with Sky. We believe only the Centrifuge platform has proven the capability to unlock RWA and DeFi at a deep foundational level, and our work with our integration partners proves so.

4. Do you offer or plan to offer other products that could be appropriate for Spark or other SubDAOs?

Yes. Centrifuge is proud to share that we have lined up several product opportunities that are a strong fit for the Spark portfolio.

These products are rooted in our experience with the Maker/Spark ecosystem, with a deep understanding of Spark’s preferred risk tolerances, and aligned around partnerships that accentuate

In the supplementary documents sent privately to the submissions panel, we offer two new funds specifically tailored to the future investment objectives of Spark.

  • AAA Highly Liquid Bond Fund targeting returns in excess of Treasuries
  • BBB+ Enhanced-Yield Public Credit Fund targeting higher returns for more diversification along the risk curve

These funds aim to offer forward-looking solutions that help Spark navigate a volatile rate environment and macroeconomic uncertainty. Our objective is to position Spark to capitalize on potential market dislocations over the next 12 to 36 months, and support Spark’s own aspirations to diversify beyond the risk-free rate.

In summary

Centrifuge, Anemoy, and their partners are uniquely positioned to provide Sky with an innovative, fully integrated, and compliant tokenization solution. Our proven track record, combined with the expertise of strategic partners like Janus Henderson, ensures that we can meet Sky’s current needs and adapt and grow as the market evolves. By leveraging our decentralized infrastructure and deep knowledge of traditional finance, we are confident that this proposal will set a new standard for onchain asset management.

We are excited about the opportunity to deepen our partnership with Sky and pioneer the next chapter of real-world asset adoption together. Thank you for considering our proposal.

Reach out to get started today

Lucas Vogelsang, Cofounder of Centrifuge | @spin • lucas@centrifuge.foundation |
Martin Quensel, Cofounder of Anemoy & Centrifuge | @martin • martin@anemoy.io |
Anil Sood, Cofounder of Anemoy | @Anil_Sood • anil@anemoy.io |

item.title: Atlas Edit Weekly Cycle Proposal
item.dc:creator: rune
item.description:
Summary

  • Updates GSM delay exception for Smart Burn Engine based on request from BA Labs. (This update has also been reviewed/approved by Ephy).
  • Adds exemption for the Facilitator anonymity requirement for Ecosystem based on discussion with Governance Facilitators.
  • Makes minor updates to language in some places to incorporate initial feedback on Atlas v2.

BA Labs Edits

  • Replace A.1.8.2.2.8 - Smart Burn Engine Breaker Exception (Portal) / A.1.9 - Sky Core Governance Security - Governance Security Delay Requirements - Smart Burn Engine Breaker Exception (Github)

    • Smart Burn Engine Breaker Exception - The SplitterMom contract allows for the disabling of the Smart Burn Engine without the GSM delay.

      This functionality is available so that Sky Governance can react to emergencies regarding the Smart Burn Engine.

      Since the Splitter contract also allocates USDS from the Surplus Buffer to USDS Seal Rewards, the activation of SplitterMom also disables these rewards until the activation is reversed by Sky Governance.

Ecosystem Facilitator Anonymity Exemption

  • Add a new Core Document as a subdocument of A.1.4.7 - AC Requirements Of Anonymity And High Operational Security (Portal) / A.1.4 - Alignment Conservers - Powers And Constraints - AC Requirements Of Anonymity And High Operational Security (Github) to read as follows:

    • Exemption From Facilitator Anonymity Requirement - The Facilitator “Ecosystem” is exempt from the anonymity requirement, as well as the requirement of high levels of operational security insofar as the latter requirement relates to maintaining anonymity. This exemption applies solely to the Facilitator “Ecosystem”, as they onboarded into the role prior to the ratification of Atlas v1 (March 27, 2023), which introduced the anonymity requirement for Facilitators.

    This exemption applies to limit the effect of the following provisions: A.1.6 - Facilitators - Facilitator Operational Security - Facilitators Must Maintain High Level Of Operational Security; A.1.6 - Facilitators - Facilitator Operational Security - Derecognition Required Where Facilitator Operational Security Is Compromised; A.1.6 - Facilitators - Facilitator Operational Security - Facilitators Must Err On Side Of Caution; and A.0.1 - Atlas Preamble - Definitions - Facilitator.

    This limited exemption takes precedence over any conflicting provisions in the Atlas.

Atlas Axis Team Edits

  • Replace A.1.5.2 - Delegated Voting Power (Portal) / Delegated Voting Power - Element Annotation (Github)
    • Delegated Voting Power - The element “delegated voting power” refers to the ability of SKY holders and Sealing users to entrust their voting power to a Delegate Contract, allowing the Aligned Delegate controlling that contract to cast votes in the Sky Governance process on their behalf. The SKY holder or Sealing user always maintains full ownership of their tokens.
  • Replace A.1.5.5 - Total Votes Delegated (Portal) / Total Votes Delegated - Element Annotation (Github)
    • Total Votes Delegated - The element “total votes delegated” refers to the cumulative voting power that has been delegated to a Delegate Contract by SKY holders and Sealing users.
  • Replace A.4.1.1 - USDS (Portal) / A.4.1 - A1 - Core Tokens - USDS (Github)
    • USDS - USDS is the Stablecoin product of the Sky Protocol. It is designed to remain stable against USD, and its supply is regulated through the Peg Stability Module and the Allocation System, as governed by the Stability Scope.
  • Replace A.5.2 - Accessibility Reward (Portal) / A.5.3 Accessibility Reward (Github) to read as follows:
    • Accessibility Reward - This Article defines an Accessibility Reward System to incentivize third-party frontends and Stars to attract USDS users, Sky Savings Rate (SSR) users, and Star users.

item.title: Information for USDS integrators
item.dc:creator: ecosystem-team
item.description:
General Information

1. What is the project name?

Sky Dollar

2. What is the USDS token?

USDS is an upgraded version of the DAI token. Upgrading is optional. It is an ERC-20 token with permit functionality and EIP-1271 signature validation. The USDS token also enables two-way conversions between DAI and USDS tokens, using the mint and burn functions of both tokens. The conversion rate of the stablecoin is 1 DAI to 1 USDS.

3. What is the governance structure of the Sky Protocol and its USDS token?

The USDS token is the stablecoin token of the Sky Protocol, a decentralized and permissionless protocol formerly known as the Maker Protocol, governed entirely by its community, the Sky Ecosystem (formerly known as MakerDAO). Post dissolution of the Maker Foundation in 2021, the ecosystem continues to remain decentralized.

4. When will the token migration take place?

The start of the token migration from DAI to USDS is scheduled for September 18

5. What is the process for migrating from DAI to USDS?

The migration is conducted using the DAI-USDS Converter contract, which allows two-way conversions between DAI and USDS using the mint and burn functions of both tokens. This process is non-custodial and permissionless, meaning that users retain full control of their assets throughout the conversion.

6. What is the project website?

The project is a decentralized and permissionless protocol, meaning there are no official websites; it can be accessed through various gateways including Sky.money and Spark.fi, while anyone is free to develop new front ends, and users can always interact with the protocol directly through its smart contracts, including those contracts governing the Sky native tokens.

Tokenomics and Supply

1. Will the migration introduce new tokenomics?

USDS is meant to replace DAI as the stablecoin of the Sky Protocol, so its function remains the same with the added ability to earn token rewards and to access the Savings Rate.

2. What is the roadmap for USDS token functionality after the migration?

Please review the Sky Atlas for additional information on Sky Ecosystem governance approved features.

Technical Specifications

1. What is the token/coin address?

USDS : 0xdC035D45d973E3EC169d2276DDab16f1e407384F

2. What platform(s) is your token built on?

USDS is built on Ethereum, as an ERC-20 token .

3. Where can I find the smart contract code for USDS tokens?

The smart contract code can be found in the GitHub repository for MakerDAO .

4. If you are able to provide a security audit report by a third-party security firm, please provide the URL.

The audit reports can be accessed here .

Regulatory and Compliance

1. Are there any jurisdictional restrictions for using the Sky Protocol and its USDS stablecoin?

As a decentralized and permissionless protocol, the Sky Protocol itself, including the contracts for its native stablecoin, USDS, and native governance token, SKY, have no inherent jurisdictional restrictions. USDS tokens, and the Sky Protocol, are by design, borderless and accessible to anyone with an internet connection and the ability to interact with the Ethereum blockchain.

Independent interfaces that serve as gateways to the Sky Protocol may, at their own discretion, choose to implement their own access restrictions in light of regulatory considerations. However, these restrictions are specific to those interfaces and do not reflect any jurisdictional restrictions imposed by the Sky Protocol itself.

Some interfaces, such as Sky.money, geo-block or restrict a number of jurisdictions, for some or all of the functions provided by the Sky Protocol. Please see the Sky.money Terms of Use for more information.

2. Is the token designed to facilitate anonymous, obscured, or privacy-enhancing transactions?

USDS tokens, being standard ERC-20 tokens on Ethereum, have the same level of pseudonymity as any other Ethereum transaction. The Sky Protocol does not add or remove any anonymity features, maintaining the base level of transaction transparency inherent to the Ethereum blockchain.

Resources

  1. Sky.money - An independent frontend user interface providing general access to the Sky Ecosystem and product features
  2. Sky Token Smart Contract on GitHub - Smart contract code for USDS
  3. Audit Report on GitHub - Third-party security audit for USDS

item.title: Smart Burn Engine - Transaction Analysis and Parameter Reconfiguration Update #9
item.dc:creator: DeFlamiingo
item.description:
Introduction

As Sky Ecosystem transitions through the Endgame upgrades, some adjustments to core protocol mechanisms have to be made in order to enable various new upcoming additions and comply with the language in the Atlas V2. The Atlas V2 governs the Sky Ecosystem and had been recently ratified by the decentralized governance.

Majority of the Smart Burn Engine related changes for the current phase of new modules and features implementation, were already included in the Token and Product Launch Parameter Proposal. However, the Atlas V2 states further required changes which were not included in the aforementioned proposal. Mainly, the change of the underlying strategy which only accumulates SKY instead of increasing on-chain liquidity and decreasing the Rate of SKY Accumulation to slightly underestimate the approximated net protocol income.

We also provide the SBE transaction analysis which covers the 15 June 2024 - 11 September 2024 period and an analysis for configuration of Rate of SKY Accumulation and cost optimization for bump and hop configuration.

We pulled data from Uniswap DAI/MKR LP, as well as Dai Stablecoin, while ETH prices are weighted average prices across major exchanges. That provides a general overview of the amount of DAI used and LP tokens accumulated, which can help determine total execution costs, efficiency, and LP-focused metrics.

Smart Burn Engine - Performance to 11 September 2024 - Public

Smart Burn Engine - Parameter Configuration 11 September 2024 - public

Further information can be found on the Makerburn site.

New Atlas V2 SBE Language Definitions

The new Atlas V2 language definitions, which were not yet implemented in the Token and Product Launch Parameter Proposal are the following:

  • A.3.5.1.1.2 - SKY Accumulation states that by default the Smart Burn Engine must be configured to directly accumulate SKY only.

  • A.3.5.1.1.2.1 - Rate of SKY Accumulation states that the Rate of SKY Accumulation must be configured to slightly underestimate the net surplus income.

Smart Burn Engine Parameter Proposal

BA Labs, acting as Stability Advisor, recommends to the Stability Facilitator to propose the following Smart Burn Engine parameter changes, which must be polled and included next available executive vote, according to the language in the Atlas V2.

  • Increase the hop parameter for 1,386 seconds from 10,249 seconds to 11,635 seconds.

  • Decrease the bump parameter for 40,000 DAI from 65,000 DAI to 25,000 DAI (USDS in practice).

  • flapper: Change underlying strategy from FlapperUniV2 to FlapperUniV2SwapOnly (0x374D9c3d5134052Bc558F432Afa1df6575f07407)

  • want: 0.98 * WAD

  • pip: SWAP_ONLY_FLAP_SKY_ORACLE (0x61A12E5b1d5E9CC1302a32f0df1B5451DE6AE437)

  • pair: USDS/SKY UniV2

SBE transaction analysis

For the period 15 June 2024 to 11 September 2024, the SBE used 18,280,583 DAI—of which 9,150,000 were spent and 9,130,583 paired—to accumulate 181,695 units of Uniswap v2 DAI/MKR LP token.

In the period 15 June to 12 July, the DAI necessary to be paired dropped from 74,851.59 to 74,850.00 and has increased from 64,859.30 to 64,866.16.15 in the period 12 July to 11 September. This is mainly due to the pool size slightly dropping in TVL from the second half of August, hence increasing the market impact of SBE transactions

From 15 June to 12 July (27.15 days), the SBE executed 6 actions, equal to 3.03% of the theoretical maximum of 198 transactions given hop 11,826. The same is seen between 12 July and 11 September (58.06 days), where the SBE still transacted below the theoretical maximum of 489, executing 141 transactions (28.83%), given a hop of 10,249. The main reason behind those delays is the surplus buffer being below the activation threshold set at 55M.

Surplus Buffer

During the last two months, the Surplus Buffer has oscillated around the 55M threshold, before which it was substantially below and recently witnessed a sharp decline, related to the Launch Project. With the current parameter configuration, it would in theory be suboptimal to move towards larger bumps.

Argumentation for Parameter Configuration

Rate of SKY Accumulation

The Rate of SKY Accumulation is now set to approximate and slightly underestimate the yearly net income. To have a more conservative estimate, we set the Rate of SKY Accumulation equal to 80% of the estimate of annual profit hereby calculated:

This approach allows the Surplus Buffer to slowly grow above its upper limit while ensuring that most of the net surplus income is used by the Smart Burn Engine and Sealing. The parameters will be further adjusted at the time of Sealing Activation implementation. For the approximation of net protocol income we are not considering the liquidation penalty, PSM tin/tout fees, USDS/SKY UniV2 impermanent loss/profit and MKR related expenses. Liquidation penalty is not a constant source of revenue, PSM related fees are insignificant and will not exist after PSM-USDC-A offboarding in LitePSM Phase 3 migration, while the USDS/SKY UniV2 impermanent loss/profit and MKR related expenses do not impact protocol’s financial solvency in terms of pure USDS or DAI cash flows.

Bump and Hop Parameter Reconfiguration

Looking at the UniV2 DAI/MKR pool at time of writing (at the time of execution, the liquidity will be migrated to UniV2 USDS/SKY, it currently stands at 139.7M TVL. At the same time, the 3-month trailing average of ETH price is ~3,012 USD, while gas costs have considerably dropped. Looking at the optimal parameter configuration in order to minimize the estimated yearly costs, we achieve a bump of 25,000 and a hop of 11,635 seconds.

In terms of gas consumption, the new system with Splitter contract is slightly more efficient, the estimate is between 85-90% compared to the previous system.

Change to the flapper strategy

The change to the flapper underlying strategy from FlapperUniV2 to FlapperUniV2SwapOnly will effectively replace the current existing strategy which uses DAI (USDS in practice at the time of these changes being executed) to increase USDS/SKY liquidity by strategy which is only accumulating SKY. The spell will also onboard the pip corresponding to the new flapper.

Like the existing DAI/MKR UniV2 LP token, the SKY tokens will be accumulated to the MCD Proxy address. The receiver address is hard coded and immutable in the Splitter contract.

Proposed Language Edits to Atlas V2: A.3.5 - Surplus Buffer and Smart Burn Engine

Should the above recommended parameter changes be approved and executed by Sky Governance, BA Labs, acting as Stability Scope Advisor, requests the Governance Facilitator to reflect the updated values in the following Atlas articles.

A.3.5.1.1.3.1.1 - Hop Parameter Amount of Seconds

The hop parameter is: 11,635 seconds

A.3.5.1.1.3.3.1 - Bump Parameter Amount

The bump parameter is: 25,000 Dai

A.3.5.1.1.3.4.1 - Pip Parameter Address

The pip parameter is: 0x61A12E5b1d5E9CC1302a32f0df1B5451DE6AE437

Conclusion

Main takeaways:

  • The SBE is currently transacting below the theoretical rate of SKY Accumulation, due to the surplus buffer upper limit being below the 55M USDS threshold.
  • The market impact of SBE’s activity is slightly increasing, meaning that parameters should be reconfigured towards lower bump and larger hop.
  • The main two changes are the change to the strategy which will now accumulate SKY instead of increasing on-chain pool liquidity and in addition the Rate of SKY Accumulation is being adjusted to target 80% of approximate net protocol income according to the language of the Atlas V2.

BA Labs will continue monitoring the SBE and propose updates to the parameters and meta parameters according to the language in the Stability Scope when necessary.

item.title: Tokenization Grand Prix Application - OpenEden $TBILL
item.dc:creator: OpenEdenLabs
item.description:
I. Product Summary

The First Native On-chain TBILL Vault
The OpenEden Tokenized U.S. Treasury Bills Fund (“TBILL Fund” or “Fund” or “Token Issuer”) is the first regulated U.S Treasury Bills Fund that is offered 24/7/365 on-chain through the OpenEden TBILL Vault (“OE TBILL Vault”). The OE TBILL Vault is deployed natively on Ethereum, Arbitrum, and XRPL offering a DeFi UI/UX while offering the most institutional-grade and compliant access to U.S. Treasury Bills (“T-Bills”) yield on-chain. Having launched the Fund in April 2023, The TBILL Fund has a 18 months live track record which ranks amongst the longest in the market. The Fund is also an on-chain native vault that utilises smart-contract technologies for settlement.

A Robust Regulatory-First Approach for a Global Audience
OpenEden’s TBILL tokens (“$TBILL”) are issued by Hill Lights International Ltd (“TBILL Fund”), which is a British Virgin Islands Financial Services Commission (“BVIFSC”) regulated professional fund established under the British Virgin Islands Securities and Investment Business Act 2010. The bankruptcy-remote TBILL Fund is managed by OpenEden’s affiliated entity, Adam Eve Capital Pte Ltd (“AEC”) which is a licensed fund management company (LFMC) that holds a Capital Markets Services License under the Securities and Futures Act 2001 and is regulated by the Monetary Authority of Singapore (“MAS”). The investment manager of the TBILL Fund, AEC operates under an investment mandate to invest in short-dated T-Bills. $TBILL tokens of the Fund can be offered to Non-U.S Professional Investors defined under BVI SIBA Act and to U.S Accredited Investors defined under U.S Securities Act of 1993 Rule 501a (the Fund had filed a SEC Form D Notice to offer under Reg D 506c).

Institutional-grade Foundation with Best-in-Class Partners
The TBILL Fund’s portfolio of T-Bills are bought, sold and custodised through the Fund’s licensed Prime Broker, UK FCA registered StoneX Financial Limited, and custodised in the Prime Broker’s licensed sub-custodian, being BNP Paribas Bank, New York in segregated accounts in compliance with UK FAC’s CASS rules. As the Token Issuer is a regulated fund managed by a licensed fund manager, there are stringent regulatory requirements including the appointment of an independent fund administrator to (i) provide independent daily valuation of the $TBILL token’s Net Asset Value (“NAV”); and (ii) participate as an independent multi-sig party for all fund asset transfer transactions as an additional safeguard against fraud. The Fund has also appointed KPMG as its tax advisor and is subject to annual audits on its balance sheet and financials. More recently, the TBILL Fund was awarded an “A-bf” Bond Fund Rating by Moody’s, the first and only of any tokenized T-BIlls product globally to receive an “investment-grade” credit rating. The “A” rating from Moody’s is a validation of OpenEden’s dedication to building a reliable primitive for the DeFi ecosystem to access tokenized T-Bills as a source of on-chain yields. Ernst & Young also completed an independent audit on the OE TBILL Vault’s critical processes and controls in relation to the TBILL Fund’s KYC/AML procedures, valuation methodologies and the Fund’s asset transfer and custody procedures and controls. OpenEden is proud to have achieved the second highest rating with no critical or high risk findings.

Truly Crypto-native, Transparent and 24/7/365 Real-time Access
$TBILL tokens can be minted instantly 24/7/365 on-chain via the OE TBILL Vault using USDC, and $TBILL tokens are held in the investor’s self-custodial wallet. The OE TBILL Vault platform offers real-time, instant on-chain minting of T-Bill backed tokens, thus removing settlement risks and allowing investors to earn yield from the point of minting till the point of redemption, maximising capital efficiency.

  1. Project name: OpenEden Group

  2. Product name: TBILL (OpenEden Tokenized U.S. Treasury Bills Fund)

  3. Product type / underlying asset: U.S. Treasury Bills

  4. Issuer jurisdiction: British Virgin Islands (Issuer), Singapore (Investment Manager)

  5. Product website: https://openeden.com/

  6. Primary contact name, title, and method of contact:

    Contact name: Jeremy Ng
    Title: Co-Founder
    Email: jeremy.ng@openeden.com
    Telegram: @ly3333

II. Company Details

1. Company description

OpenEden offers 24/7, on-chain access to tokenized US Treasury securities for Web3 CFOs, DAO treasury managers, and buy-side institutional investors seeking low-risk, highly liquid crypto cash management solutions.

We are the first tokenized real-world asset (“RWA”) issuer to receive a Moody’s “A” rating. Since launching in early 2023, OpenEden has already become the largest issuer of tokenized US Treasuries in Asia and Europe.

As part of our end-to-end tokenization stack, OpenEden Group owns and operates a licensed investment management entity in Singapore, which manages the BVI-registered fund that issues the $TBILL tokens.

OpenEden’s mission is to bring real-world assets to DeFi to unlock trillions of dollars in value. We believe internet-native money will make real-world assets accessible to everyone, creating a more inclusive and free-flowing economy.

2. Key personnel biographies

Jeremy Ng, Co-Founder
Jeremy is the Co-Founder of OpenEden Group (“Group”) and has over 24 years of experience in institutional finance, fintech, and digital assets. He is also the CEO and Chief Portfolio Manager of Adam Eve Capital (“AEC”), the Group’s wholly-owned Monetary Authority of Singapore regulated fund management company that manages the TBILL Fund. Prior to co-founding OpenEden, Jeremy was Gemini Exchange’s APAC CEO having started the Singapore office in 2020 building the team to 50 and establishing the firm as the #1 fiat on-ramp exchange in Singapore.

Before embarking on his crypto journey, Jeremy spent 20 years in Tier-1 Investment Banks specialising in derivatives. He was Goldman Sachs’ Head of Cross Asset Derivatives solutions for Hong Kong & Singapore and also served for 5 years as APAC CEO for Swiss-Headquartered Leonteq, managing their Singapore, Hong Kong and Japan business where he specialised in structured derivatives. III. Product Information

1. Describe the product:

Proposed Product : OpenEden $TBILL
As previously explained above in this RFP, the issuer of the $TBILL, being the TBILL Fund, is a registered professional fund (“Fund”) established under the British Virgin Islands Securities and Investment Business Act 2010 (“SIBA”) and regulated by the BVIFSC. The TBILL Fund is managed by AEC (as defined above), a wholly owned subsidiary of the OpenEden Group, which is a licensed fund management company (LFMC) that holds a Capital Markets Services License (CMSL) under the Securities and Futures Act 2001 and is regulated by the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS). The TBILL Fund is rated “A” by Moody’s.

The TBILL Fund operates the OE TBILL Vault, a smart contract vault that provides investors with direct exposure to a pool of short-dated U.S. T-Bills and overnight reverse repurchase agreements through the minting of the $TBILL. $TBILL is backed 1:1 by short-dated U.S. T-Bills and a small portion of U.S. Dollar (“USD”) held in bankruptcy remote segregated accounts in the Fund’s name. $TBILLs can be minted instantly 24/7/365, allowing investors to earn yield backed by the U.S. government on their USDC subscription at the point-of-mint itself, rather than having to wait up to T+2 business days as compared to traditional funds.

The OE TBILL Vault operates on a zero-trust protocol, ensuring that all transactions are fully atomic, automated, transparent and managed on-chain without manual intervention. The protocol smart contract dictates that $TBILL can only be minted in the presence of the underlying asset, USDC, thus ensuring each token is always backed by actual assets. This minimises reliance on trust, making our system more secure and transparent than traditional incumbents. The OE TBILL Vault does not have the capability to freely mint tokens, which significantly reduces the risk of unauthorised token creation.

The OE TBILL Vault is a permissioned protocol, which means that an investor has to meet specific criteria before the investor is eligible to hold $TBILL issued by the Fund. The OE TBILL Vault is currently only accessible to “Professional Investors’’ as defined under SIBA and to U.S. “Accredited Investors’’ within the meaning of Rule 501(a) of Regulation D promulgated under the U.S. Securities Act. $TBILL can only be minted and redeemed via the OE TBILL Vault by whitelisted wallets that have been fully onboarded after completing the Fund’s KYC/KYB process. As a permissioned token, $TBILL are transferable between whitelisted wallets.

The $TBILL token is an EIP-20-compliant representation of an investor’s economic interest in the Fund. By depositing USDC and minting $TBILL, the investor will have legal rights to the redemption value of the net assets held by the Fund, proportional to the amount of $TBILL the investor holds relative to the total outstanding supply of $TBILL. The $TBILL minted by the investor are held in the investor’s whitelisted self custodial wallet.

Whitelisted investors are also provided with access to the investor dashboard visible on the OE TBILL Vault dApp. The dashboard provides the investor with a real-time view of their $TBILL balance and their realised and unrealised P/L. Please find the sample screenshot of the investor dashboard displayed below.

Investment strategy
The Fund aims to provide the highest possible level of income generation while maintaining liquidity and maximum safety of principal. Given these requirements, the Fund will be managed according to the following metrics:

  • Target portfolio composition: A pool of short-duration U.S. T-Bills
  • Target weighted-average maturity of portfolio: Less than 6 months

U.S. T-Bills’ credit quality is rated as follows:

  • Moody’s: AAA
  • Fitch: AA+
  • S&P: AA+

Any securities held as safe custody assets by the Fund are deposited in StoneX Financial Ltd.’s sub-custodian, BNP Paribas New York. All investors are able to view the Fund’s portfolio holdings on the OE TBILL Vault dApp. The portfolio holdings are updated daily displaying the estimated yield-to-maturity (net of fees), the weighted average maturity, and the individual holdings.

14. Provide a description of the subscription and redemption process. Include a diagram of the flow of funds, including each party involved.

The screenshot of the TBILL dapp below shows how SparkDAO can deposit USDC to mint $TBILL. The funds flow diagram below assumes SparkDAO to be depositing into the OE TBILL Ethereum Vault as an illustration.

Subscription Flow

  • SparkDAO’s whitelisted wallet connects to the TBILL Ethereum Vault and initiates a deposit request by depositing USDC (ETH) into the Vault on the Ethereum network. Please see the Deposit/Withdraw box on the screenshot above.

  • The $TBILL smart contract executes the following steps in an atomic settlement process –

    • The latest $TBILL token price is retrieved from the on-chain oracle.
    • USDC (ETH) is transferred to the Fund’s Coinbase Prime account.
    • $TBILL tokens are minted and are issued to SparkDAO based on the latest live on-chain price.
    • These tokens are deposited into SparkDAO’s whitelisted wallet for self custody and an automated email notification will be sent to SparkDAO.

  • Upon deposit in Coinbase Prime, the USDC is converted to USD and transferred to the Fund’s prime brokerage account (StoneX Financial Limited) on the same business day.

  • Once the fiat transfer has settled in StoneX, the Investment Manager (“AEC”) invests the deposited USD into T-Bills for T+0 settlement. T-Bills are custodised in StoneX’s sub-custodian, BNP Paribas New York in a segregated account.

  • All funds transfers and wallet address whitelisting are controlled by multi-sig approvals involving independent Fund Administrator as mandatory signatory to ensure proper controls are in place.

Redemption Flow

  • SparkDAO connects its whitelisted wallet to the TBILL Ethereum Vault and submits a redemption request. Please see the Deposit/Withdraw box on the screenshot above. SparkDAO will receive automated email notification that a redemption request is accepted.

  • Upon notice of the redemption request, the Investment Manager (“AEC”) liquidates T-Bills into USD fiat T+0 settlement through the Fund’s prime broker, StoneX.

  • USD fiat in the Fund’s StoneX account is transferred to the Fund’s Coinbase Prime account. Upon deposit into the Coinbase Prime account, the USD is converted to USDC, and is transferred to the TBILL Ethereum Vault.

  • This initiates the activation of the redemption queue on the $TBILL smart contract vault, an atomic process that results in –

    • The most recent $TBILL price is fetched from the on-chain price oracle.
    • The $TBILL tokens present in the withdrawal queue are burned.
    • The corresponding amount of USDC (ETH) is transferred to SparkDAO’s approved address.

  • Additionally, SparkDAO will receive an automatic email notification confirming the successful processing of the redemption request.

  • All funds transfers are controlled by multi-sig approvals involving independent Fund Administrator as mandatory signatory to ensure proper controls are in place.

The $TBILL issuer, being the TBILL Fund, is a registered professional fund incorporated in the British Virgin Islands and regulated by the BVIFSC. The Certificate of Recognition can be sent via private email upon request.

Every tokenholder has legal and contractual rights to the redemption value of the net assets held by the Fund, proportional to the amount of $TBILL the investor holds relative to the total outstanding supply of $TBILL.

As mentioned above, the $TBILL issuer, being the TBILL Fund, is a BVIFSC-regulated professional fund established under the British Virgin Islands Securities and Investment Business Act 2010.

The investment manager of the Fund, being AEC, is a Capital Markets Services Licence Fund Management Company regulated by the MAS

4. How is bankruptcy remoteness established for assets of this product? Does the issuer have more than one product? Please provide separately any related legal opinions or supplementary documents regarding bankruptcy remoteness.

The issuer is the Fund and is constituted as a BVI professional fund which is regulated by the BVI Financial Services Commission (“BVIFSC”). The Fund has no other products and issues tokenised units of the Fund (“ie. $TBILLs”) to its investors.

The Fund has also appointed AEC as its investment manager.

Bankruptcy remoteness is achieved for the assets of the Fund through its legal structuring. The Fund is a separate legal entity with its assets segregated from the assets of OpenEden Group entities (ie. AEC (the investment manager), OEL (the technology service provider) ).

The Fund holds all assets with licensed custodians in accounts or digital asset wallets controlled by the Fund. No operational capital of the OpenEden Group entities are commingled with the Fund’s assets or in the Fund’s accounts or digital wallets.

The legal structuring, segregation of assets, independent and licensed custodians are intended to achieve bankruptcy remoteness, additionally, these measures are also mandated by law and regulations as both the Fund and AEC (the investment manager) are regulated and licensed entities respectively.

Clear investor disclosures, assets held in the Fund’s name, clear segregation of Fund assets from OpenEden Group assets, independent fund administrator approval of asset transfers are mandatory requirements in order for both the Fund and AEC to maintain their regulated status.

The Fund and AEC are also subject to mandatory yearly external audits of their financial statements as well as internal/external audit on their processes (for example, custody and valuation) to ensure that the Fund and AEC are compliant with their regulatory requirements.

Each $TBILL holder’s rights are also set out in the Fund’s offering documentation and they have legal and contractual rights to the net redemption value of the underlying assets held by the Fund, and such rights/claims are ranked ahead of the management shareholders of the Fund via a legally enforceable subordination deed. Management shareholders do not have economic participation rights to the underlying assets held by the Fund. All terms are documented in the Private Placement Memorandum (provided in Supplementary documents section).

With respect to the licensed custodians of the Fund, StoneX Financial Limited, the UK FCA licensed custodian of the Fund’s fiat and bond assets, also ensures that the Fund’s assets are segregated in its sub-custodians books to ensure that the assets clearly belong to the Fund in the event of the insolvency of StoneX or its sub-custodian BNP Paribas. The following excerpts below are extracted from StoneX Financial Limited’s custody services contract with the Fund.

4. Describe the technical implementation of your product

OE TBILL Vault
The OE TBILL Vault is developed based on the ERC-4626 Tokenized Vault standard, which is the industry standard for tokenized vaults. Subscriptions and redemption requests are seamlessly and transparently carried out on-chain through the OE TBILL Vault smart contract, which retrieves the latest price from the TBILL price oracle to process the request without manual intervention.

The smart contract necessitates that $TBILL can only be minted in the presence of the underlying asset, USDC, thus ensuring that each $TBILL token is backed by actual assets. No $TBILL can be minted freely by the smart contract, which eliminates the risk of unauthorised token creation.

The OE TBILL Vault smart contract has the whitelist feature that only allows wallet addresses that have been whitelisted with the smart contract to interact with the smart contract. Consequently, only whitelisted wallets can hold $TBILL. $TBILL can only be transferred between whitelisted wallets.

$TBILL Token and Token Price
The $TBILL is developed based on the ERC-20 token standard, and is minted or burned when USDC is deposited or redeemed from the OE TBILL Vault respectively.

Token holders earn a return by holding $TBILL, where the token price is expected to increase in value over time. That increment in token price directly reflects the returns generated by the underlying T-Bills portfolio held by the Fund.

The $TBILL token price is calculated as the Net Asset Value (“NAV”) per token. The token price can be derived by dividing the NAV of the Fund by the total outstanding supply of $TBILL. The $TBILL token price was launched with a default value of 1.000000.

On-Chain Price Oracle
The price feed is a service responsible for consolidating and disseminating financial market data to the on-chain price oracle. Its primary function is to precisely calculate the $TBILL token price and transmit price data onto the on-chain price oracle. The integrity of the price feed is ensured through the price guards mechanism.

Price guards are a circuit breaker mechanism designed to monitor the price of an asset or token and take appropriate actions when the price deviates unexpectedly beyond a predefined threshold. The purpose of the price guard is to protect the OE TBILL Vault or any other system from price manipulation or extreme price fluctuations by halting the OE TBILL Vault.

On-Chain Governance and Controls
OpenEden has put in place a robust system of internal controls to uphold the safety of the OE TBILL Vault. These include the implementation of a consensus-based approval mechanism to move the OE TBILL Vault’s assets between venues, timelock, a role-based governance protocol, and multi-layered physical security, among others.

Timelock – Timelock implements a safety mechanism during the process of changing the OE TBILL Vault’s treasury wallet address. This is done as a precaution to protect the funds from being drained by a malicious user in the rare occasion when all the multisig wallets are compromised and the hacker is able to switch the address to offramp the funds. This timelock mechanism will give admins a 24-hour window to offramp the funds if the change in treasury address is an unintended one.

Multisig – The TBILL Vault is multisig, requiring multiple private keys, including the Fund’s independent third-party fund administrator to authorise and sign off on transactions involving on-chain assets. The use of on-ramp and off-ramp services will also be limited to authorised representatives from the OpenEden team via multisig operations. Off-chain assets, meanwhile, are held on the Fund’s regulated custodians’ platforms, and all actions initiated by any one core team member will require checking and confirmation by another core team member to be authorised. In addition, the Fund’s independent fund administrator will have oversight and governance control over all fund movements involving on-chain and off-chain assets held by the Fund. Even in the event of a smart contract breach or a hack, most of the OE TBILL Vault assets are held with regulated custodians at any given time.

5. What audits have been performed on the smart contracts involved with your product, by whom, and when?

Verichains Lab, 29 March 2023:

openeden.com

Verichains%20Public%20Audit%20Report%20-%20OpenEden%20Vault%20-%20310323.pdf

527.74 KB

Hacken, 31 October 2023:

audits.hacken.io

OpenEden audits by Hacken

Blockchain security analysis for OpenEden. Smart contract audits, protocol reviews, and penetration tests. View our detailed report for critical insights and security recommendations.

VI. MakerDAO Ecosystem

1. Describe any previous relationship with MakerDAO and familiarity working with DAOs

The OpenEden team has been recently selected as one of six tokenized T-Bills service providers (out of more than thirty applicants) by the Arbitrum Foundation as part of the Arbitrum Stable Treasury Endowment Program. The selection process was vetted by an expert committee that focused on product structuring, quality, regulatory compliance and transparency. The selection of OpenEden as a service provider amongst 30 other participants is testament to the superior product offering, and strong commitment towards supporting DAO communities and to provide high-quality treasury management services.

Furthermore, our Co-Founder Eugene has been investing and supporting crypto-native projects since 2017, and advisor to HFT firm DWF Labs has since amassed more than 700 crypto projects with a number of DAO foundations. Through his extensive network of crypto-native connections, he would be able to bring much value and expertise in any formal DAO engagement. He was also a core member of a relatively small DAO called DAOvergence.

OpenEden has onboarded multiple DAOs as users and thus is familiar and comfortable working with the often unique structures associated with DAOs.

2. Beyond yield, how might your product benefit the SparkDAO and/or MakerDAO ecosystem?

The investment into OpenEden’s $TBILL is a strong step forward in demonstrating SparkDAO’s and Sky’s commitment towards diversifying its reserves into industry-leading tokenized money market funds that have excellent product structuring, regulatory compliance and transparency. OpenEden’s $TBILL is currently the only product on the market with an “A” rating by Moody’s and the largest Asia-based issuer of tokenized T-Bills. Furthermore, an allocation into $TBILL would entitle SparkDAO to additional token incentives as OpenEden Group consolidates its plans to launch a governance token in the coming months.

OpenEden has a network of institutional partners such as State Street, Moody’s etc that can be aligned for an institutional adoption of SparksDAO and its product offerings.

OpenEden group is very active and dominant in the regions of Asia and Europe, which positions us as the leading non-U.S. tokenized firm that can aid SparksDAO’s international expansion, especially in Asia.

As the partnership with SparkDAO scales, OpenEden is well-positioned to collaborate with particularly on the launching of new products with an RWA focus due to its end-to-end tokenization suite of services such as issuance, tokenization, portfolio management, and distributions across a variety of blockchain networks.

OpenEden group also owns a Singapore MAS Licensed Fund Management Company which allows us to be an investment advisor and manager to guide any DAOs, Sub-Daos or treasuries with regulatory-compliance.

Finally, as tokenized RWAs continue to gain traction, this investment by SparkDAO could galvanise other projects and users in the Sky ecosystem to participate in the growth of tokenized RWAs within the ecosystem, either through direct investments or partnership integrations. The Sky ecosystem could be well-positioned to become the leading ecosystem for supporting tokenized RWAs.

3. Does the product have integrations with any other platforms?

$TBILL tokens have been accepted as eligible collateral by Hidden Road Partners through a tri-party agreement between $TBILL tokenholders, Zodia Custody and Hidden Road Partners. Investors can custodise $TBILL tokens in Zodia and use as collateral to trade OTC with Hidden Road Partners. $TBILL is also accepted as collateral by several OTC options Market Makers. $TBILL is integrated with Resonate, a yield-swap protocol for RWA yields. Discussions are currently ongoing for $TBILL to be used as collateral on CEXes, lending/borrowing DeFi protocols, DEXes and others.

4. Do you offer or plan to offer other products that could be appropriate for Spark or other SubDAOs?

In the future, OpenEden’s tokenization platform has plans to expand its product offerings to higher yield products, such as tokenized private credit, tokenized investment-grade and high-yield bonds, tokenized delta-neutral yield strategy etc . Such products can provide SparkDAO with the option to move up the risk-curve and earn higher yields on its assets, while maintaining the high standards of product structuring, transparency and regulatory compliance that the OpenEden platform provides.

VII. Supplementary Documents

The following documents will be sent via private email:

  • Subscription and Redemption Agreement (Non-U.S.)

  • Investment Management Agreement

  • Registered Professional Fund Letter

item.title: Information for SKY integrators
item.dc:creator: ecosystem-team
item.description:
General Information

1. What is the project name?

Sky Protocol

2. What is the SKY token?

SKY is an upgraded version of the MKR token. Upgrading is optional. It is an ERC-20 token with permit functionality and EIP-1271 signature validation. The SKY token also enables two-way conversions between MKR and SKY tokens, using the mint and burn functions of both tokens. The conversion rate is 1 MKR to 24,000 SKY.

3. What is the governance structure of the Sky Protocol and its SKY token?

The SKY token is the governance token of the Sky Protocol, a decentralized and permissionless protocol formerly known as the Maker Protocol, governed entirely by its community, the Sky Ecosystem (formerly known as MakerDAO). After the dissolution of the Maker Foundation in 2021 the ecosystem has remained decentralized and no legal entity is in charge.

4. When will the token migration take place?

The start of the token migration is scheduled for September 18.

5. What is the process for migrating from MKR to SKY?

The migration is conducted using the MKR-SKY Converter, which allows two-way conversions between MKR and SKY using the mint and burn functions of both tokens. This process is non-custodial and permissionless, meaning users retain full control of their assets throughout the conversion.

6. What is the project website?

The project is a decentralized and permissionless protocol, meaning there are no official websites; it can be accessed through various gateways including Sky.money and Spark.fi, while anyone is free to develop new front ends, and users can always interact with the protocol directly through its smart contracts, including those governing the Sky native tokens. Maker/Sky features are commonly adopted across the DeFi and crypto space.

Tokenomics and Supply

1. Will the migration introduce new tokenomics?

SKY is meant to replace MKR as the governance token of the Sky Protocol (formerly known as the Maker Protocol), so its function remains the same with some added perks to incentivize governance participation. The migration introduces some new tokenomics on top of that. For example, the Sky Protocol will distribute 600 million SKY (approximately 2.56% of the current total supply) per year as rewards to eligible users. This new reward structure incentivizes participation in the protocol and helps to align token holders’ interests.

2. What is the roadmap for SKY token functionality after the migration?

Please review the Sky Atlas for additional information on Sky Ecosystem governance approved features.

Technical Specifications

1. What is the token/coin address?

SKY : 0x56072C95FAA701256059aa122697B133aDEd9279

2. What platform(s) is your token built on?

SKY is built on Ethereum, as an ERC-20 token.

3. Where can I find the smart contract code for SKY tokens?

The smart contract code can be found in the GitHub repository for MakerDAO .

4. If you are able to provide a security audit report by a third-party security firm, please provide the URL.

The audit reports can be accessed here .

Regulatory and Compliance

1. Are there any jurisdictional restrictions for using the Sky Protocol and its SKY token?

As a decentralized and permissionless protocol, the Sky Protocol and its native governance token, SKY, have no inherent jurisdictional restrictions. The SKY token and the Sky Protocol are, by design, borderless and accessible to anyone with an internet connection and the ability to interact with the Ethereum blockchain.

Independent interfaces that serve as gateways to the Sky Protocol may implement access restrictions in light of regulatory considerations. However, these restrictions are specific to those interfaces and do not reflect any jurisdictional restrictions imposed by the Sky Protocol itself.

Some interfaces, such as Sky.money, geo-block a number of jurisdictions, including the U.S and the U.K, for some or all of the functions provided by the Sky Protocol. Please see the Sky.money Terms of Use for more information.

2. Is the token designed to facilitate anonymous, obscured, or privacy-enhancing transactions?

SKY tokens, being standard ERC-20 tokens on Ethereum, have the same level of pseudonymity as any other Ethereum transaction. The Sky Protocol does not add or remove any anonymity features, maintaining the base level of transaction transparency inherent to the Ethereum blockchain.

3. Is the token e-money or a digital representation of fiat currency?

No, the SKY token is not e-money or a representation of fiat currency. The SKY token is the native governance token of the Sky Protocol.

Resources

  1. Sky.money - An independent frontend user interface providing general access to the Sky Ecosystem and product features
  2. Sky Token Smart Contract on GitHub - Smart contract code for SKY
  3. Audit Report on GitHub - Third-party security audit

Synchrotron Labs

Synchrotron Labs is a startup committed to pioneering decentralized governance solutions by delivering vertically integrated services that bridge the gap between traditional Web2 models and the evolving Web3 ecosystem. We empower the growth and success of decentralized organizations through tailored research, innovative governance design, and professional delegation services. With a strong foundation in data analytics and insights, we equip DAOs with the tools and infrastructure necessary to scale and thrive in the increasingly interconnected Web3 landscape.

Looking ahead to 2025, Synchrotron Labs will expand its vertically integrated offerings with the launch of a Cryptocurrency Trading Desk. Drawing on the expertise of our team, this new venture will focus on comprehensive digital asset trading services, including OTC trading, swaps, and market-making, solidifying our role as a key player in both governance and trading across decentralized finance.

Help Wanted: Intern at Synchrotron Labs – Passionate Learners Welcome!

If you are passionate about the future of decentralized governance and eager to dive into the world of Web3 we would like to hear from you. item.title: EA Status Update (3/3): Powerhouse Sustainability
item.dc:creator: ltcol_kilgore
item.description:
We previously provided an update on our product vision and development and another update on Powerhouse’s contributions to the Sky Ecosystem. The update below explains how our work for Sky creates opportunities to develop similar products for other organizations.

Tldr:

  • The Endgame vision involves spinning off non-core businesses to unlock value beyond the MakerDAO/Sky Ecosystem.
  • For Powerhouse, this means finding product-market-fit for our tech and open-source legal templates as generalizable infrastructure that can help optimize operations for any DAO or open organization.
  • Powerhouse has worked closely with StableLab in building software solutions for Arbitrum DAO. This is an important proof of concept for our technology with over 100 project teams using Powerhouse software through Arbgrants.com.
  • Powerhouse is pioneering its open-source legal templates by dogfooding our own products, setting up an Operational Hub to handle contributor payments.
  • We have also begun discussions with other DAOs and service providers on using Powerhouse software, as well as begun to broaden our message to new communities

Background

An important part of the Endgame vision is to unbundle non-core businesses to unlock value beyond the MakerDAO/Sky Ecosystem. As a first step to become a truly self-sustainable project, Powerhouse was introduced as an independent Ecosystem Actor in June 2023 when it spun off from the former SES Core Unit. As the third update in our series, we now want to discuss our latest progress on validating product-market-fit and exploring other Powerhouse use cases.

While we continue to provide core operational support to Sky, the update below will discuss Powerhouse’s path to sustainability outside of our original use case, focusing on:

  • Product adoption outside of the original expense reporting use case
  • Arbgrants.com, which Powerhouse built in collaboration with StableLab
  • Continued traction for the Fusion collaboration platform at ArbGovHack
  • Open-source legal infrastructure for Scalable Network Organizations (SNO)
  • Powerhouse’s outreach and potential next uses for the Powerhouse stack

Using document models outside of expense reporting

Powerhouse’s initial scope of work was to streamline expense reporting and ensure verifiability for the Sky Ecosystem. Our scope expanded with Endgame implementation, which demonstrated a broader need for more robust operational software across the ecosystem. This meant the development of a new platform that could create customizable interactions for organizational data input, along with tools and applications that repurposed, visualized and automated organizational data. This led to the development of Powerhouse’s “document models”, the fundamental data unit of the Powerhouse network, a decentralized synchronization protocol (DocSync), and four applications that leverage these technologies and work seamlessly together.

As part of our work for Endgame, Powerhouse built the RWA Reporting Tool and now the Atlas Explorer pilot, currently hosted at https://sky-atlas.powerhouse.io/ .


Both of these tools make it easier for the broader community to understand granular details about different aspects of Sky’s operations beyond expense reporting - Powerhouse’s first use case. These two new tools show the flexibility of Powerhouse’s document model architecture and the need for customized operational software that can improve the efficiency and transparency of open organizations.

Building on this experience, Powerhouse has begun to find product-market-fit outside of Sky with the launch of Arbgrants.com (more in next section below). The needs of ArbitrumDAO were similar to the Sky Ecosystem albeit in a different operational domain (grants management). For both, there was a need to upgrade their operations, transparency, and data entry and monitoring. Specifically, moving from forums and spreadsheets to a customized web app with native authentication that does not create lock-in through a centralized data provider.

Building out the grants management for Arbitrum is the beginning of productizing the Powerhouse platform. Yet, grant programs are only one segment of DAO operations. Powerhouse has found reception from other projects on building customized software to optimize their operations. Financial professionals, in particular, have responded positively to the availability of the complete revision history for any file, made possible by Powerhouse’s events-based architecture.

ArbGrants: Enabling accountability for Arbitrum DAO

With the experience of building the RWA Reporting Tool for Sky, Powerhouse teamed up with StableLab to launch ArbGrants.com in June to monitor Arbitrum’s Long Term Incentive Pilot Program (LTIPP) and in August added the Short Term Incentive Program (STIP). Arbitrum has been a leader in the DAO space in distributing grants to projects to encourage building on the protocol.

Hoping to spur growth on Arbitrum, the DAO approved almost $100m to be distributed to participating projects through LTIPP and STIP, but did not yet have the necessary operational infrastructure to track how these funds were used and their effectiveness. StableLab, an active governance participant, was tasked with administering these programs. StableLab sought a solution more robust than spreadsheets and forum posts, and thought Powerhouse was the ideal partner.

Powerhouse had been building a new set of applications to create process-oriented workflows to gather data in a simple and standardized UX, so this project presented an opportunity to build the second use case on the Powerhouse stack (the first being the RWA Reporting Tool for Sky)

ArbGrants uses Powerhouse’s Renown product for authentication to ensure that only authorized users can submit ARB incentive reports. It generates a Decentralised Identifier (DID) based on one’s Ethereum address and issues a credential on Ceramic. Project teams then submit their reports through Powerhouse’s Connect product, which uses the DocSync protocol to ensure the latest version of documents are displayed across the network for the grant program manager and community.

Close to 100 projects have used Renown and Connect to submit biweekly reports. The high number of projects submitting reports has been an excellent stress test and proof of concept for Powerhouse’s Document Synchronization Protocol.

Powerhouse’s work for ArbGrants is ongoing as we enhance user features and continue to improve UX. We believe that grants management tools are a key opportunity to build for other DAOs. All Powerhouse’s software is open-source, and we are optimistic that we can leverage our experience building ArbGrants to make the tooling available to other projects. If you’d like to learn more about Powerhouse’s work for Arbiturm, we recently provided a status report on ArbGrants in the Arbitrum forum.

More Fusion traction with ArbGovHack award

In another exercise in product validation, Powerhouse participated in the ArbGovHack, hosted by ArbitrumDAO prior to ETHCC in Brussels. A hackathon request called for greater budget transparency, so Powerhouse formed a group to develop a proposal based around our Fusion dashboard application. Fusion was pioneered as the MakerDAO Expenses Dashboard but has grown to a generalizable structure to visualize any organizational data.

Our submission created a four-step process to build an operational reporting foundation for a public Fusion dashboard.

We placed 3rd place in the hackathon, but ultimately have held off on developing it further in order to focus on our core roadmap.

While the hackathon award was the most visible recognition for us, the interest in Powerhouse from the many suppliers of the ArbitrumDAO ecosystem was the strongest signal for our product validation. We will continue to maintain relationships with potential future partners in the nascent DAO govops space.

Open-source legal infrastructure for Scalable Network Organizations (SNO) and Powerhouse

In order to scale to real-world impact, open organizations need more than an on-chain DAO. They need legal infrastructure and a business model that can be sustainable for all parts of the ecosystem. We refer to this broader web of legal entities and value flows as a Scalable Network Organization (SNO).

We have begun validating the SNO model by dogfooding with Powerhouse itself. We have recently set up an Operational Hub for Powerhouse contributors. This legal entity can accept funds from an unincorporated DAO or multisig and pay the service providers of the DAO or SNO. This makes it easy to recruit contributors and easily pay them in crypto or fiat. This new entity is an important first step to demonstrating the SNO model.

We have also been working on other open-source legal templates to help projects streamline their early operations. We have completed work on an entity with membership conditions tied to a multisig participation agreement (MPA). This means that the members of our Operational Hub can be legally determined by signers of a multisig, an important liability step for an early project wanting to do onchain operations.

We’ve started initial discussions with potential projects who are interested in applying the SNO model to their organization

Powerhouse Outreach and Next Opportunities

Powerhouse’s broad ambitions make it challenging to hone a message, but we are making progress.

We have started to spread the Powerhouse message and build a community around optimizing operations and sustainability for open organizations. In May, we organized Powerbrunch, an event at Full Node in Berlin to showcase our work. And in July, in preparation for ETHCC, we updated our website and unveiled individual pages for each of our four products. In the next month, we will publish a series of blog posts on our core technologies (Document Models and our decentralized synchronization protocol, DocSync) and our public legal infrastructure.

Now our focus is on reaching more builders and those in the trenches of operations for open organizations. On the development side, we are focused on reducing the cost of creating custom solutions for projects by enhancing the builder experience and improving the system’s stability performance.

We are planning a side event in Bangkok alongside Devcon to provide an opportunity to grow our developer community by helping builders to play around with document models and DocSync. Details to come.

Conclusion

This is the final of three update posts from Powerhouse. The first was focused on the Powerhouse product vision and the second post was on Powerhouse’s contributions to Sky. We will provide additional updates on our progress in the future.

If you’re interested in learning more, jump into our discord, follow us on our (newly active) X/Twitter profile and check out our recently updated website

The market findings over the last few months have validated our thesis around the appeal of Powerhouse core technologies and our path to sustainability. We are well positioned to leverage these technologies to expand our product offerings and accelerate business development in 2025.

3 posts - 2 participants
